showerReviews.reviewText: The pool is fine, there‚Äôs the main one and a smaller one which is also used for diving but they lift the floor and it‚Äôs a younger child pool. The baby pool is tiny. All the pools felt bit cold which is not unusual for this area unfortunately my 9 month old was shivering in the baby pool which was the warmest one but once he started kicking around seemed okay. The changing rooms absolutely stink and that is the reason we won‚Äôt go back because I couldn‚Äôt stand it and the changing rooms were slimy on the floor and we struggled changing with no clean baby changer to use so had to hold him and get us all dry and dressed which took a lot time in that smell. On the plus the flumes were really fun though! There is a cafe but we didn‚Äôt use.
showerReviews.author: Heather Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's okay, there are two pools one for laps one for kids playing, the temperature and cleanliness of the pools are great, the flumes or slides are fun and stable and reasonably clean.

Good for all ages and abilities and the staff are all very nice üëç

The changing rooms are questionable in size and sanitation but okay, I recommend flip flops or pool socks though...

Gyms all good quality equipment and nicely lay out, although it's small.

Changing rooms for girls is small and there's not much privacy in there.

Overall good üëç

Prices are okay as well

Fun special events eg cancer research fundraisers are great for kids day out!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had the displeasure to attend one of the toddler sessions at this pool last week.

As soon as I entered reception I was met with the most disengaged receptionist I've ever interacted with. Eyes down, throughout the whole interaction and there was no information at all about the facilities.

I went in with my child to get dressed and realised I had no coins for the lockers so carrying all my things and my toddler I made my way back to do reception. To ask if they could change a five pound note. I waited patiently for the receptionist to finish her conversation with other staff and after a good minute she turned to me and said "Yes?" in a condescending tone.

I asked her if she had chnage for a fiver and in the most smug voice through a sarcastic grid she replies that "this is a cashless business and we'd have to just take our bags to pool side".

I said nothing and just went pool side with the little one as suggested with all of my things. There was no real place to put my items as every part of the floor poolside was wet. So I had to strategically place the items in an area far from my view that had to be dry.

The actual poll for the toddlers is more of a fun space and less about teaching your little ones to swim so I'd not recommend this pool if you had that in mind.

The session starts late and Finishes 15 minutes before the hour ends so be aware if you planned an hour. Not a big deal but I believe they may check the pool water for quality during this period.

Getting dressed in the pool with toddlers is painless. They have a baby chnage mat as well as a upright chair for them to sit in while you get changed yourself. So no need to double team with a partner here.

Weirdly as a CASHLESS business the lockers require cash as well as the hair driers. So I really think the receptionist was just mocking me.

I'd highly recommend that reception take some time off to reflect on whether they want to remain at the business as they clearly don't enjoy their job. To management at this location consider putting your staff through hospitality training as it will go a long way to help the business grow. I know better Gym is still a council backed franchise but a minimum standard should be maintained.
showerReviews.author: Timur

showerReviews.reviewText: Parkside Pools & Gym in Cambridge offers a variety of activities including a 100 station gym with cardio, resistance equipment and free weights, three swimming pools, diving boards and flumes, caf√© and over 40 fitness classes per week including the very popular Circuits, Boxfit, Yoga, Power Pump and Total Body Conditioning. The centre also offers a variety of kids activities including, children's birthday parties, swimming lessons and much more.  We have a wide selection of flexible memberships available with no long term contract, so whether you are looking for a low cost gym or a full access membership, we will find something suitable for you.

locations.address: ÓÉàAbbey Leisure, Studios, Whitehill Rd, Cambridge CB5 8NT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: It‚Äôs basically a game of chance for whether the pool will be open or not when you arrive. They need to sort the timetable out - it‚Äôs so consistently wrong that it‚Äôs worse than useless and you can‚Äôt phone anybody to check. 3 times in the last 3 months I‚Äôve wasted a trip there only to be told the pool is closed when I arrived (at 4pm when the website very clearly says it‚Äôs open for lane swimming until 6 - turns out it shut at 3:30). Incredibly frustrating and not a word of apology from any of the staff.
showerReviews.author: Luke H

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked the small pool for our daughter and us for an hour this afternoon. We were not warned on the booking interface that half the pool would be closed due to swimming lessons.

The fee was the same as any other time when you have the entire small pool.

A lot of parents were staring at the pool, some were taking pictures of others, not just the children. There was a parent who openly laughed about someone's full body swimming dress and took a picture of it.

There was a time when there were 12 of us in the half of the small pool. It was terribly uncomfortable while the benches were full of parents.

The changing room area was very cold. The water in the shower can be hardly called lukewarm, and it has to be restarted every 7 seconds. Ridiculous.

Overall, this was a really disappointing experience.
showerReviews.author: Z. Z.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall, this is a good place to work out. Staff are friendly and professional and they make the most of the facilities they have at this centre. They close the pool for half an hour numerous times a day to clean and this positively shows - pool area, toilets and changing rooms, gym equipment all seem to get freshened up numerous times a day.
This absolutely feels like a facility for the community. Wheelchair users can be lifted into the slow lane to swim and the medium speed lane is extra wide to compensate. The small learners pool always seems animated with youngsters and accompanying adults. The gym is popular and has a lot of equipment. The music is the right volume and not annoying. Steven took great care to design a workout programme for me and it's excellent.
This facility hosts the local kayak club, who practice rolls in the pool during dedicated sessions. There are tunnel slides open sometimes by the pool and a little sauna at poolside. There are often swimming lessons in one lane.Tables next to the lobby provide a place to eat snacks. There are some fitness classes that seem popular.
Just be sure to check the pool times so you don't turn up to swim when it's closed for cleaning.
Good work everyone, making this a vibrant fitness centre for the community.
showerReviews.author: Donna McLuskie

showerReviews.reviewText:
The leisure centre as a whole is quite decent , considering it isn't that big, they've managed to pack everything in there.
The pool is alright to, a bit chilly sometimes, but that's to be expected. The changing rooms can be a bit grim, but that depends on what day you go there, I've noticed anyway. The sauna is nice, but a bit small. The same goes for the gym upstairs, though it does have a fair bit of equipment in there, so I guess that kind of makes up for it. They do host different exercise classes every week day, which look exciting, and they have an outdoor exercise area for those that want a bit more peace, the place could do with a lick of paint, and maybe some modernising but overall it's good.
showerReviews.author: Bloodclart Black bwoi

locations.title: Leys Leisure Sports Complex
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Leys School, Trumpington Rd, Cambridge CB2 7AD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My children have started swimming here and I have to say, I think their swim scheme is fantastic. Not your standard swim scheme like Swim England, but children from the age of 6 are swimming lengths?? Amazing! The facilities are incredibly outdated and poor so they lose a star there, but we come on a Saturday and the two younger ladies  and male teacher are great at their job.

Only downside is their carpark is a 5 min walk away from the pool, but it‚Äôs free and we make it work. We tried another swim school down Long Road and the teaching standard was so poor compared to the Leys.

If the Leys had updated facilities, it would be the dream place, however, the swim teacher standard is well worth the money
showerReviews.author: Amelia Jones

showerReviews.reviewText: We took our son for an intensive 1-week swimming course, as he is very behind compared to his school mates. He had half an hour each day with a woman called Lucy, who was utterly amazing and moved him on from being afraid of the water to being able to swim up and down the whole length (with a float) - she provided really superb tuition and understanding. Heartily recommended, I'm absolutely delighted with what she's achieved with him.
showerReviews.author: Pete Caldwell

showerReviews.reviewText:
We just moved to Cambridge from London, had my 1st swimming lesson for my 5 years old daughter in Leys swimming club, security guard is rude, swimming instructor is rude, I would not sign up again .

The administrator who called  up to register for my daughter was rude too - said "you want to sign up or not ???" I was asking which days of holiday break that they will have, he said no idea but you want to sign up or not ? His answer was "once you paid you will know ?!"

You cannot drop off, you cannot pickup at the Leys swimming pool, their car park facilities are 15 to 20mins walk to swimming pool, you cannot walk thru the school , you have to walk outside round the school, for a young 5 years to walk there and back in the winter wet and cold weather?!

You do not feel welcome to the leys swimming club at all!!!

Unbelievable services that they provided and hard to believe its part of an independent school.
showerReviews.author: S L

locations.address: ÓÉàAddenbrooke's Hospital, Hills Rd, Cambridge CB2 0SN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been coming here quite a few years now. No money has been spent on it since. The gym equipment is failing, limited and worn out. Changing rooms are dated, without air conditioning and no where near big enough. Lockers are often broken. Staff are often pleasant as none of this is to their fault. The facilities are clearly run as a money turnover with no intent to improve failing facilities for the customers who are paying a fair amount of money to use it. Management have clearly realised the location convenience of being on the addenbrookes site ha allowed them to make no effort in improvements. Unfortunately, there is no other options close by.
showerReviews.author: Christopher Trethewey

showerReviews.reviewText: Excellent gym with gentle and helpful trainers. Lots of classes to choose from. Large with multiple rooms for different activities. Large swimming pool to go. Great value for money

showerReviews.reviewText: I am actually really disappointed about the Frank Lee centre. I am hoping they are not actually part of CUH because they don‚Äôt follow the kind aspect of our ethos ‚ÄúSafe, Kind and Excellent‚Äù I have been going there for more than 2 years now and not once have I ever seen or heard reception staff welcome me. Maybe except one guy. You are not a 5 star hotel, you don‚Äôt have to smile and say welcome but at least don‚Äôt make me feel awkward by giving me a weird vibe. The swimming staff can also be rude but I‚Äôm ignoring that because health and safety sometimes needs a harsh saying. Every time I leave they don‚Äôt make me feel like wanting to come again. The people who actually go to the leisure centre are 10x kinder. Some people need to come to the leisure centre due to relax, unwind after a long days work. We don‚Äôt need extra mental stress. If I really didn‚Äôt want to go and relax to be healthier, I would have stopped going. Being inclusive is also very important as it‚Äôs hard to find people like that nowadays. They never say bye or welcoming the way other reception staff usually are. One time I thought they said ‚Äúciya‚Äù to me. When I said ‚Äúbye‚Äù they laughed because they were not saying it to me, it was to one of their colleagues. I absolutely hate this mentality some people have. People need to learn to be nice. Pretend if you have to! I am not giving 1 star because they are at least informative. I guess they have to be. Thanks
showerReviews.author: Oish Isl

showerReviews.reviewText: I am actually really disappointed about the Frank Lee centre. I am hoping they are not actually part of CUH because they don‚Äôt follow the kind aspect of our ethos ‚ÄúSafe, Kind and Excellent‚Äù I have been going there for more than 2 years now and not once have I ever seen or heard reception staff welcome me. Maybe except one guy. You are not a 5 star hotel, you don‚Äôt have to smile and say welcome but at least don‚Äôt make me feel awkward by giving me a weird vibe. The swimming staff can also be rude but I‚Äôm ignoring that because health and safety sometimes needs a harsh saying. Every time I leave they don‚Äôt make me feel like wanting to come again. The people who actually go to the leisure centre are 10x kinder. Some people need to come to the leisure centre due to relax, unwind after a long days work. We don‚Äôt need extra mental stress. If I really didn‚Äôt want to go and relax to be healthier, I would have stopped going. Being inclusive is also very important as it‚Äôs hard to find people like that nowadays. They never say bye or welcoming the way other reception staff usually are. One time I thought they said ‚Äúciya‚Äù to me. When I said ‚Äúbye‚Äù they laughed because they were not saying it to me, it was to one of their colleagues. I absolutely hate this mentality some people have. People need to learn to be nice. Pretend if you have to! I am not giving 1 star because they are at least informative. I guess they have to be. Thanks
showerReviews.author: Oish Isl

showerReviews.reviewText: No hot water is a big deal when you're going for a swim on a cold day, and looking forward to a nice warm shower afterwards.  There were some signs up saying "limited hot water".  These should have been bigger, clear and said "no hot water".  Reception staff extremely unfriendly.  Not impressed.

locations.address: ÓÉàChesterton Rd, Cambridge CB4 3AX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Fab place for a swim. It's very long at 100 yards or 91 metres. Early in the morning divided into slow, medium and fast lanes. Some of the slow lane was reserved for swimming lessons but still left around 50m available. Can pay as you go or get a discounted rates if you're a member. Sauna can be added on for a few pounds extra. Water isn't heated but wasn't too chilly, 20¬∞ on a cloudy July day. Recommend flip-flops to walk between shower and changing rooms as stone ground has leaves and other bits of trees falling on it. Caf√© on site with coffees and snacks. Reception provide a token for the lockers or some people leave their bag on a poolside bench.
showerReviews.author: Stephen Hailey

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is such a fabulous facility.
Being a
Long poll it gives a different experience from a standard indoor or 25m pool. Unheated other than by the sun. Great changing and shower facilities, toilets, friendly staff. A really good place to have some longer swim practice plus it‚Äôs shallow at both ends so no deep end issues that some people experience. The whole place is amazing. Clean and well looked after, just great. We travel 70 miles each way to visit it, it‚Äôs that good! In the winter it is cold but amazing, if you are a cold water swimmer  it‚Äôs the best!
showerReviews.author: Emma Goodridge-Hobson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fabulous place for a swim on a hot Sunday afternoon to cool down.
The water isn't heated but they have the temperature on the gate just so people are aware.
It was very busy with people sitting poolside soaking up the sun, or having a dip.
Gave it a bash and once I put my feet in to test it out - went straight for a jump and landed right in the middle making sure I didn't land on anyone.

It's definitely a long pool at 91m so swimming that distance was definitely a workout.
Nice onside cafe as well and lots of changing facilities split into male and female.
They do have tokens for lockers to keep your stuff safe but people do leave their bags by the pool.

Will be back next summer ‚òÄÔ∏è
showerReviews.author: Ollie J Wright

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a HUGE (90m) unheated outdoor pool by the side of the river. Parking nearby is limited and entails either a walk across the green or across a foot bridge over the river to get to the lido. The pool temperature was around 20¬∞ (displayed at the entrance) when we visited. There are a limited number of lockers on site, and you need to pay for a token (50p, non-refundable) at the entrance. Changing cubicles are rustic and there are limited showers/toilets, which were filthy and flooded when we were there. While the pool is a glorious and unusual swim (because of the length), and there were plenty of attendants and lifeguards, it's not especially clean - we swallowed a lot of debris while swimming (leaves, insects), and emerged from the pool to the (dirty, flooded) showers with leaves, insects and seeds in our swimwear. The pool is shallow at each end with a deep section in the middle. While this pool is definitely worth a visit for the experience of swimming super-long lengths, there are much better, and more uplifting lidos at Hitchin, Ware, or Peterborough.
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Jesus Green lido is  a gem in the heart of Cambridge, fortunately preserved when other lidos have been gutted.  If you want a swim, year-round, this is the place to do it, taking account of the fact that it's not heated.  There's a sauna on site, so you can oscillate between pool and sauna to get a quasi-Scandi experience.  It can be bracing to get into the water, but when I have done even a short swim with one or two sauna warmups on a cool day, it's marvellous.
In summer, the lido can get crowded at the "wrong" time of day and in the school holidays, particularly if it's sunny.  Best avoided at such times if you'd like to do some reasonably serious swimming.
showerReviews.author: STUART G

I've been swimming at IVC for over 10 years & go 3 times a week for swim & Sauna! & Last month I have never felt so Humiliated... Told now I cannot use the nice clean changing rooms because it's Members only now so had to use the disgusting school ones with communal showers & Filthy toilets & thought okay it is what it is, then I went in the Sauna as I have always done to then after 5 mins some kid staff member opened the sauna door Infront of everyone & told me it's Members only now you need to get out... I told him I wish to at least use the clean toilets before I go so He followed me in there watched Me & made me feel like some sort of criminal.
I am never going again after this sadly, since gone to the Hive Ely & it's like a different world beautiful clean facilities.

locations.title: Sports Centre and Gym, University of Cambridge
locations.address: ÓÉàPhilippa Fawcett Dr, Cambridge CB3 0AS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great gym. Had membership here on-and-off between 2018 and 2025. Reasonable prices, spacious, and great facilities. You won't find better in Cambridge unless paying 2-3x the price, and it is much better than the offerings here in London. Relatively uncrowded, large amounts of room, new equipment. Some reviewers complain about the changing rooms but I found them to be good - much better than I'm used to elsewhere.

As others have said, a swimming pool (or, IMHO, a sauna) would make this absolutely top-class, up there with David Lloyd and others. Beyond that, it wins in all areas. To top it off, it's a pleasant cycle ride to reach.
showerReviews.author: Dave Martin

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member on and off here for around eight years. It‚Äôs generally a great place. Showers not been upgraded once in the time I‚Äôve been coming. It‚Äôs actually quite grotty.  But the facilities are amazing in a lot of ways.

My big gripe tho is the quite populous customer service team.

Whenever I contact them for anything, usually around gym class bookings, but more recently I was asking about block booking the hall. They are amazingly rude! Like, in that institutional way. And pass agg about just about everything.

Today I attended a class.  Their check in service didn‚Äôt work on the door so I emailed after to say it didn‚Äôt work. I swiftly got a telling off saying I MUST make sure to make contact with a member of staff at the time.

I have a job. I dont have time to chase someone down for their system not working.

Also moving exercise classes out of studio for during exam times totally sucks.

If I lived the other side of town, I‚Äôd go back to Nuffield in a moment! They just know how to speak to ppl and take care of basics like changing rooms/showers etc.
showerReviews.author: Piers Henriques

showerReviews.reviewText:
I write this review from a place of frustration because I've loved this gym for a long time, it's a big part of my life and I don't want to have to change gyms.  But this gym seems to have been completely abandoned; for example, today there wasn't AC, hygiene, music or enough benches (see pictures taken on the 22/08/21 by myself - I also recorded a video showing empty disinfectant bottles and cleaning tissue but couldn't attach to this review).

But most importantly: for the love of god, turn on the air conditioner.  While I understand the lockdowns have put a lot of pressure on businesses, this is a gym without windows.  The lack of AC has become a hazard and it encourages germs such as covid to thrive in this much heat.

I‚Äôve also had to stop using the massage chairs (the reason why I upgraded to ‚ÄòPlus‚Äô) because the warm water on top of the heat makes it unmanageable.  Staff have been telling members for months that the AC is going to be fixed "very soon", "when we get a piece we're missing", "next week". Enough is enough, this is 2021, it doesn't take this long to fix an aircon.

I hope that this review helps Pure realise that this gym is no longer good value for money and they really need to step up.  Many thanks.
showerReviews.author: Esperanza Suarez

showerReviews.reviewText:
I write this review from a place of frustration because I've loved this gym for a long time, it's a big part of my life and I don't want to have to change gyms.  But this gym seems to have been completely abandoned; for example, today there wasn't AC, hygiene, music or enough benches (see pictures taken on the 22/08/21 by myself - I also recorded a video showing empty disinfectant bottles and cleaning tissue but couldn't attach to this review).

But most importantly: for the love of god, turn on the air conditioner.  While I understand the lockdowns have put a lot of pressure on businesses, this is a gym without windows.  The lack of AC has become a hazard and it encourages germs such as covid to thrive in this much heat.

I‚Äôve also had to stop using the massage chairs (the reason why I upgraded to ‚ÄòPlus‚Äô) because the warm water on top of the heat makes it unmanageable.  Staff have been telling members for months that the AC is going to be fixed "very soon", "when we get a piece we're missing", "next week". Enough is enough, this is 2021, it doesn't take this long to fix an aircon.

I hope that this review helps Pure realise that this gym is no longer good value for money and they really need to step up.  Many thanks.
showerReviews.author: Esperanza Suarez

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great Experience at RP Fitness in Cambridge

Although I‚Äôm only in Cambridge for a month as a visitor, I didn‚Äôt want to miss my workouts, so I searched for a gym on Google and came across RP Fitness. The staff were incredibly helpful in setting up my membership ‚Äî the whole process was quick and easy, and payment was straightforward. The prices are also very reasonable compared to other gyms.

I started my one-month membership today and was impressed right away. The gym is modern, spread over two floors, and has every type of fitness equipment you might need. The ventilation is great, and the locker rooms are clean, well-maintained, and feel very secure. In terms of location, it‚Äôs quite convenient ‚Äî I walked there in about 15 minutes.

Highly recommended for anyone staying in Cambridge, even for a short time, who wants to keep up with their fitness routine.

locations.title: PureGym Cambridge Grafton Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàGrafton Centre, Cambridge CB1 1PS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The conditioning area layout change (shifting the KB, DB and WB stands to another wall) doesn't seem to be an improvement:
- it shortens the available space (in the way having the cabinets parallel did not)
- it limits access to equipment from the sides
- by shifting the ski ergs, it frees up space that's of little use
- it makes the ski ergs unavailable during the classes (even when they're not used by the group)

From 4 years of close to daily usage and seeing how the new set-up doesn't work: could we revert to the previous, please?

It feels freeing up lockers from padlocks left overnight, adding another C2 bike (current has over 1M meters on the clock), or keeping the toilet soap topped up would make more of a positive impact.

showerReviews.reviewText: Filthy equipment and changing facilities. The sink in the women's changing rooms in particular reeks of sewage. The gym is clearly oversubscribed since it's always absolutely packed so it obviously isn't the case that they're lacking the funds to make this a more hygienic or pleasant space. There really needs to be antibac wipes available, more staff on the ground to stop school kids messing around in large groups, and more frequent cleaning to get this up to standard even for a PureGym. Will be cancelling my membership.

locations.title: David Lloyd Cambridge
locations.address: ÓÉàColdham's Business Park, Coldham's Lane, Cambridge CB1 3LH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is small & poorly stocked considering the amount of members. Its also very very busy, busier than any of the gyms I've tried in Cambridge. I always have to switch my routine, work in with people, or get in a queue, something I really didn't expect when paying ~¬£230 per month for the pleasure. Grips are old or missing, accessories are minimal (one foam roller for the whole gym??) and weight labelling on the machines is poorly done and inconsistent, I never know how much weight I'm actually pulling! Multiplying this issue, there are no staff on the gym floor available to ask quick questions to. There are PTs, but they only ever appear for private sessions, and are never just available for quick questions, something I would expect from a premium service like this.

Courts and classes are fine. There is only one small indoor swimming pool and one small outdoor pool. The indoor one is usually also very busy, with a lot of children, especially during peak times.

Spa is very nice (although there are persistent issues with stuff breaking all the time - looking at you plunge pool). Although similar to the others it is farrr too busy, leading to a paradoxically stressful experience considering how nice the facilities are themselves.

Overall very disappointed. #1 issue to fix is getting more equipment / a bigger gym. It is frankly shocking how small it is considering the cost and the amount of members, really isn't good enough. One example is only having one foam roller for the whole gym, who's idea was that??
showerReviews.author: Liam Coleman

locations.title: Everlast Gyms
locations.address: ÓÉàBeehive Centre, Coldhams Ln, Cambridge CB1 3ER, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My son and I have had a membership with Everlast Cambridge for around 3 months. I have been to a variety of gyms before but this is my son's first membership. I am very impressed by this gym, particularly the staff.

The gym is rarely over crowed and even when it's busy I have never struggled to get on what I need. The pool is great and I havent experienced it being too busy. The changing rooms and showers have always been clean and good quality. We pay for the champion membership which gives us guest passes and money off clothes etc, we have taken advantage of both.  The gym has a very welcoming feel to it.

My son (17) feels confident enough to go by himself now. The staff are always welcoming and helpful.

Areas of improvement:
The sauna etc hasn't worked since I started, I am not too concerned as the monthly price is low for a gym with these facilities, but it would be nice to have.

There is one young male worker who unfortunately let's the team down. No issues when I am there but certainly doesn't treat my son with the same welcoming respect when he comes by himself, can be rude and unhelpful. Despite him being a quiet, polite gym user. Guessing he is assuming that a teenage boy might cause trouble, unfortunate stereotype which he should bare in mind when supporting all customers.

I‚Äôm just for the swimming mainly early morning and in that respect, having only just joined i find it to be quite simply superb, The changing rooms are high quality and clean with good showers, There‚Äôs nothing that disappoints

Update :  Now that i‚Äôve spent a little time at this gym  and wishing to add constructive criticism  The mention of filthy floors by others   is a totally valid one and the reason for the loss of a star.
It‚Äôs a shame because this is something that could  easily be  rectified by the proper use of industrial cleaning solutions and scrubbing machinery.
The fact that this hasn‚Äôt been done and that  the steam room remains closed without any sign of it ever opening again   means that  maybe there something we don‚Äôt know about?
is the pending desire by fat cats to redevelop the beehive centre which at the moment is being rejected stopping the likes of Mike Ashby  (yes he of  Sports Direct fame who owns these chain of gyms) from investing anymore money into this particular gym in Cambridge?
The staff are always very polite  to me and deserve to  be proud of the gym they work in.
Come on Mr Ashby  have a word with your CEO at Everlast
is he really up to the challenge as he says he is.
What really IS the future of this gym?
would hate to see it go.
btw - great phone app , and far better than silly membership cards that get lost or misplaced
just barscan and you‚Äôre in

showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff are nice and friendly , unfortunately the centre consistently fallen below the standards I was led to expect.
‚Ä¢	The swimming pool water has consistently been very cold and certainly not at the 28¬∞C I was advised.
‚Ä¢	The swimming pool itself does not appear clean, which raises serious concerns about hygiene and maintenance.
‚Ä¢	The steam room has not been available at all since I joined.
‚Ä¢	Today female members, including myself, were directed to use the men‚Äôs changing room, which I found wholly unacceptable. I even felt compelled to take photographs as the conditions were unhygienic and inappropriate.
‚Ä¢	The changing room areas, including the marble flooring in the entrance , were dirty and poorly maintained. The floor was so unclean that I had to keep my shoes on rather than walk barefoot.
‚Ä¢	The shower gel dispensers were empty.

It is also worth noting that when the site was previously DW, the standards were far higher. At that time, there was a jacuzzi, the steam room was always available, and while cleaning was not perfect, it was far more acceptable than the current situation.

locations.title: Nuffield Health Cambridge Fitness & Wellbeing Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà213 Cromwell Rd, Cambridge CB1 3BA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôm a new member to Nuffield Gym in Cambridge. The positives are many. Facilities and the number of different classes are very good. Lots of variety to suit everyone whatever their preferences are.  The PT instructors, in particular, Finn, are very supportive and make me feel at ease which is great for someone returning to ‚Äúgym life‚Äù after many years.  The ladies changing rooms have good quality hairdryers and straighteners so this saves you having to bring your own.  There is a nice cafe to sit and relax and have a coffee/tea after a workout.  The team on reception, particularly Grace and Jess are also welcoming, helpful and approachable.

The only downsides are that it would be lovely if towels were provided and the pool was a little bigger.
showerReviews.author: Mary Maude

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôm a new member to Nuffield Gym in Cambridge. The positives are many. Facilities and the number of different classes are very good. showerReviews.author: Mary Maude

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member here forever. The pandemic seemed to be a trigger for decline. Covid was an excuse to stop towels that were included in membership but were never reintroduced.

For a year the swimming costume drier was out of order 9 times out of 10. It usually works these days but isn't very effective and needs to be upgraded.

They removed tissues from the changing rooms.

They closed 2 out of 3 spa pools and the remaining one is pool temperature with bubbles.

One day I heard some "swimmers" (a group of elderly women who spend most of the time floating and chatting) complain about the pool temperature and next day the temperature was increased such that a decent swim leaves me feeling overheated. It has been like that ever since.

Changing rooms are looking tired and shabby.  Floors are wet and grubby looking. Showers are very dated and I often have to try a few to find one where there is soap in the dispenser, the shower will turn on and the temperature will adjust.

They have added more and more classes making it very hard to find times where I can rely on a simple 3-lane configuration in the pool with fast/medium/slow lanes.

It is so busy it is hard to find a space in the car park. A good portion of the car park floods when it rains so often you have no choice but to get wet feet.

The hedge where pedestrians step out to cross to the front entrance is overgrown such that people are always stepping out in front of cars - accident waiting to happen.

There are kids classes and time slots now so it is often awkward in the changing room with kids around.

At the risk of sounding like Hyacinth Bucket, the gym attracts the wrong type of people these days.  I often find myself surrounded by groups of noisy blokes with their giant protein shakes, trying to impress each other by laughing and joking the loudest, using phones which are supposed to be prohibited  etc.

Any times I've emailed management about any issues I've never had a reply.

I'm at the point of cancelling as it's no longer pleasant.
showerReviews.author: Laszlo Plook

Especially Grace who helped us when we had many questions on our first time attending! Highly recommend!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ultimately, picking a gym is usually quite hard but this is my honest experience after 2 years at Nuffield Health Cambridge and inadvertently making use of all the services due to circumstance. For context I joined after a road traffic incident, 12 months doing rehab before getting the all clear and gaining the confidence to get myself active again.
First things first, I needed a PT (not everyone will but one) who would work with my physio and clinicians to help me phase back into exercise (after planned and unplanned surgeries), weight and functional training and this is where Aidan, my PT, came in. From the off Aidan took my goals, assessed my capability and adapted to my current state and we got going! From chatting to the other PTs I saw they could accommodate for anyone‚Äôs goals amongst them (there‚Äôs like 20 to choose from based on your goals). The process was simple, exercise tailored to my schedule/pain tolerance with daily communication on my condition and a constant feedback loop. The workouts evolved constantly keeping me on my toes and ultimately helping me get stronger & more functional. Every step of my rehab journey Aidan adapted the training and I took extra classes included in the monthly membership such as the many yoga sessions and mindful meditation to help balance getting mind and body right. Ultimately everyone chooses a gym based on needs and the cost, and comparably no other local gym came close given the access to multiple studios, a swimming pool, cold plunge jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, lobbies, cr√®che, canteen, and a handy GP/Physio should you ever need it for a fraction more of the cost of other gyms in the vicinity. I‚Äôve done the rounds with Nuffield gyms and outside of the City/Cannon Street and Barbican gym (which you pay a ¬£10 fee for as a visitor, and a cost you don‚Äôt have to pay anywhere else) Cambridge seems to be the best facilities wide (but I‚Äôm happy to be proven wrong). Also like any gym a feeling of community is always a plus but I feel like comes natural (with the staff and everyone who works out on my schedule) another thing which makes this gym different to ones I‚Äôve tried before.

P.S. If you‚Äôre like me and forget your card often Grace, Jess and the staff are always pretty chill while sorting you out with a temporary pass.
showerReviews.author: Takudzwa Bere

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ultimately, picking a gym is usually quite hard but this is my honest experience after 2 years at Nuffield Health Cambridge and inadvertently making use of all the services due to circumstance. For context I joined after a road traffic incident, 12 months doing rehab before getting the all clear and gaining the confidence to get myself active again.
First things first, I needed a PT (not everyone will but one) who would work with my physio and clinicians to help me phase back into exercise (after planned and unplanned surgeries), weight and functional training and this is where Aidan, my PT, came in. From the off Aidan took my goals, assessed my capability and adapted to my current state and we got going! From chatting to the other PTs I saw they could accommodate for anyone‚Äôs goals amongst them (there‚Äôs like 20 to choose from based on your goals). The process was simple, exercise tailored to my schedule/pain tolerance with daily communication on my condition and a constant feedback loop. The workouts evolved constantly keeping me on my toes and ultimately helping me get stronger & more functional. Every step of my rehab journey Aidan adapted the training and I took extra classes included in the monthly membership such as the many yoga sessions and mindful meditation to help balance getting mind and body right. Ultimately everyone chooses a gym based on needs and the cost, and comparably no other local gym came close given the access to multiple studios, a swimming pool, cold plunge jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, lobbies, cr√®che, canteen, and a handy GP/Physio should you ever need it for a fraction more of the cost of other gyms in the vicinity. I‚Äôve done the rounds with Nuffield gyms and outside of the City/Cannon Street and Barbican gym (which you pay a ¬£10 fee for as a visitor, and a cost you don‚Äôt have to pay anywhere else) Cambridge seems to be the best facilities wide (but I‚Äôm happy to be proven wrong). Also like any gym a feeling of community is always a plus but I feel like comes natural (with the staff and everyone who works out on my schedule) another thing which makes this gym different to ones I‚Äôve tried before.

P.S. If you‚Äôre like me and forget your card often Grace, Jess and the staff are always pretty chill while sorting you out with a temporary pass.

locations.title: The Glassworks
locations.address: ÓÉàThompsons Ln, Cambridge CB5 8AQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We attended the spa for an anniversary treat (we don't live in Cambridge) and had an 80-minute Swedish massage. Although the staff were friendly and welcoming, we were quite disappointed with the massage. We try and treat ourselves every now and again so feel we've had a wide range of experiences, and honestly this would be at the bottom of our list.

The towels when we laid down were damp and smelt musty, and throughout the massage there was a lot of movement and noise in the room - collecting things noisely out of cupboards / rustling which didn't help with relaxing.

We also felt it was quite basic - not all parts of leg were addressed for example, just parts, and the head / scalp was massaged in one place for quite a while which I personally found a bit boring and didn't really do anything.

Brought this up with the venue who offered another massage, which was not suitable and based on our experience didn't fill us with confidence, but no refund as our complaint 'didn't qualify'.
showerReviews.author: Alaina Blackwell

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Glassworks Health Club is adjacent to the Varsity Hotel in the centre of Cambridge and right by the Cam.  Because we were staying at the Hotel we could make us of the Club facilities; the gym, the steam and sauna rooms and the jacuzzi.  I toyed with the idea of booking and paying extra for a pedicure during our stay but ran out of time.

The gym is on an upper floor accessed by stairs or by lift if you can't manage them.  There are various machines and apparatus typical of gyms (I'm not a regular at these sorts of things) and lots of weights to choose from.  I only came for the weights as I have some daily exercises to perform, set by my NHS physio.

I made use of the steam and sauna rooms.   There are showers next to those, as well as in the changing rooms (which have combination operated lockers) so one can dip into the jacuzzi for a little water-jet massage.  It was great fun and I thoroughly recommend a visit, whether you're staying at the Hotel or not :)
showerReviews.author: Jacek G

locations.title: Hills Road Sports & Tennis Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàPurbeck Rd, Cambridge CB2 8PF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have decided to edit my review following the redeeming, good quality customer service regarding the incident which led me to writing my initial post.

I use the facilities here regularly for Squash and Badminton.

The badminton hall has just had the floor redone which is quite nice. Social badminton is a little pricey for playing with plastic shuttles but as there are many league clubs in Cambridge and not many sessions for beginners/intermediates this is a necessary evil.

The squash court has also just been refurbished so is very good.

I had my racket restrung in the shop located within the sports centre which has served me well.

The changing rooms are ample, as is the car park and water facilities.

Though I had an issue with one member of staff in the past this was dealt with very professionally and they far exceeded my expectations. All other members of staff have been very helpful, kind and polite.

locations.title: The Gym Group Cambridge
locations.address: ÓÉàCambridge Retail Park, Henley Rd, Cambridge CB5 8JL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Gym Group is hands down the best place to train yourself and achieve your fitness goals! One of the biggest advantages is that it‚Äôs open 24 hours a day, so you can work out whenever it suits your schedule, whether that‚Äôs early morning, late at night, or any time in between.

From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted with a clean, welcoming environment that instantly motivates you to work out. The gym is spacious, well-organized, and always kept tidy, making it easy to focus on your training.

One of the standout features is the wide range of facilities available. Whether you‚Äôre into strength training, cardio, or boxing, The Gym Group has you covered. They have an impressive variety of equipment, from free weights to resistance machines, treadmills, and rowing machines. For those who love a bit of boxing, there‚Äôs a dedicated area with bags and gloves, perfect for a high-intensity workout.

The gym also has great shower facilities, which are always clean and well-maintained, so you can freshen up after a tough session. Additionally, the layout is well thought out, with clear instructions and guidance on how to use the equipment safely and effectively, perfect for both beginners and seasoned gym-goers.

What really sets The Gym Group apart, though, is the staff. The trainers are professional, knowledgeable, and always ready to help you with your fitness journey. They offer guidance, tips, and even personalized workout plans if you need that extra push. The overall atmosphere created by the friendly staff makes every workout session enjoyable.

Overall, The Gym Group provides a fantastic environment for anyone looking to improve their fitness. With top-notch facilities, excellent trainers, a welcoming vibe, and 24-hour accessibility, it‚Äôs the perfect place to train yourself and reach your goals. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Ganesh Tamang

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Gym Group is hands down the best place to train yourself and achieve your fitness goals! One of the biggest advantages is that it‚Äôs open 24 hours a day, so you can work out whenever it suits your schedule, whether that‚Äôs early morning, late at night, or any time in between.

From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted with a clean, welcoming environment that instantly motivates you to work out. The gym is spacious, well-organized, and always kept tidy, making it easy to focus on your training.

One of the standout features is the wide range of facilities available. Whether you‚Äôre into strength training, cardio, or boxing, The Gym Group has you covered. They have an impressive variety of equipment, from free weights to resistance machines, treadmills, and rowing machines. For those who love a bit of boxing, there‚Äôs a dedicated area with bags and gloves, perfect for a high-intensity workout.

The gym also has great shower facilities, which are always clean and well-maintained, so you can freshen up after a tough session. Additionally, the layout is well thought out, with clear instructions and guidance on how to use the equipment safely and effectively, perfect for both beginners and seasoned gym-goers.

What really sets The Gym Group apart, though, is the staff. The trainers are professional, knowledgeable, and always ready to help you with your fitness journey. They offer guidance, tips, and even personalized workout plans if you need that extra push. The overall atmosphere created by the friendly staff makes every workout session enjoyable.

Overall, The Gym Group provides a fantastic environment for anyone looking to improve their fitness. With top-notch facilities, excellent trainers, a welcoming vibe, and 24-hour accessibility, it‚Äôs the perfect place to train yourself and reach your goals. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Ganesh Tamang

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is massive! Two floors filled to the brim with equipment. They have absolutely everything you need.

Additionally, there are saunas in the changing rooms. It's a bit of a shame, though, that there aren't any mixed-sex saunas where men and women can chill out together.

In the afternoons, it‚Äôs fine, but it can get quite crowded during peak hours.

The good membership price and the fact that the place is open 24/7 are huge pluses - you can work out any time of day or night.

A special mention goes to Dmitrijs, one of the personal trainers ‚Äî very professional, knowledgeable, and motivating. The overall vibe of the gym is positive and welcoming ‚Äî no ego, no pressure, just people focused on getting better. Clean facilities, great energy, and good value for money.

locations.title: JD Gyms Luton
locations.address: ÓÉàChaul End Ln, Maidenhall, Luton LU4 8FD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym itself is nice, well equipped & seems to have everything you need.
Friendly staff, though they're not always around when you need them.

The problem lies with a lot of the members there who show a severe lack of respect to the gym & other members.
I've seen people take out 6-8 dumbbells at once so other people can't use them.
I've seen people finish with their weights but just leave them on the floor instead of putting them back on the racks & it's getting to the point where I feel like I may need to challenge some of the other members on this since the staff don't bother to police the gym.

People will spend 5-10 mins on machines in between their sets whilst scrolling or taking selfies on their phones.

Some days, the dumbbell & barbell racks are nearly empty cause people just leave them on the floor.

Littering is another problem. There are plenty of bins, but people just leave their empty water bottles wherever they have been working out, whether that's in the gym, in the changing room, or in the sauna.
The toilet cubicles are often littered with toilet paper, much to the annoyance of the one cleaner who seems to work 24hr shifts there, but the poor thing struggles to keep on top of everything.
The cardio equipment tends to come with rubbish or chewing gum in the cup holders.

The showers are so vile that I've stopped using them, empty toiletry bottles, used underwear hanging everywhere, people feeling the need to spit & snot everywhere as soon as they step into the shower, it's little wonder why I kept on getting ill when using them.

The sauna is nice, but again it tends to have a few empty bottles cast aside in there. Plus members tossing eucalyptus oil everywhere to the point where you're blinded by the fumes when you walk in.

Despite going here for a year now I'm still yet to find a quiet period as the place seems to be constantly packed, especially on bank holidays.

I do think this gym has the potential to be a really great place with a really good atmosphere, the colour scheme of the gym is nice & I like the decorative plants going up the wall on the stairs.

The staff just need to really step up their game of making sure members are actually respecting the environment as small notices on the mirrors of Don't drop the weights & Please return weights after using them, clearly aren't working.

Edit: They have improved things a bit. I like the new equipment & they've utilised the space a bit more. There is much less rubbish on the gym floor, however there is still quite a bit in the changing room & on the cardio machines.

There is still a very large problem with members being too lazy to put equipment back, instead opting to just kick it aside when they're finished with it. As my video shows.
showerReviews.author: Marky2409

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym advertises 24/7, but the ventilation (AHU) is not running 24/7 as it should. It gets switched off at night and only turned back on at 5 a.m. ‚Äì which means air circulation is poor and CO‚ÇÇ levels, especially on the second floor, are extremely high. That‚Äôs not only uncomfortable but also unhealthy for members training late at night or early in the morning.

Hygiene is another serious issue. There seems to be no proper deep cleaning. For example, chewing gum has been stuck in a treadmill bottle holder for over a month without anyone noticing or cleaning it. If small things like this are ignored, it makes you question how well the rest of the facility is maintained.

Overall, very disappointing for a gym that promotes itself as 24/7. Both air quality and cleanliness need urgent improvement to meet even basic health and safety standards.
showerReviews.author: Alex

locations.title: JD Gyms Harlow
locations.address: ÓÉàunit c, 36 Broad Walk, Harvey Centre Approach, Harlow CM20 1XR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely loved this gym, but after being a member for over two years there are a few things over the last year that definitely need improving. The air conditioning is not great. The gym gets extremely hot in the summer which isn't ideal at all. Broken equipment sometimes takes a long time to fix. There have been issues with soap and toilet paper running out in the changing rooms.  There are no cleaning stations on the gym floor so if equipment is left covered in sweat there is no way to clean it off. Not many rubbish bins around so people leave  rubbish on the treadmills rather than find a bin. The cleaner can be cleaning around you on the gym floor, but usually just hoovering (sometimes between your legs when you're mid set which is a bit odd!) Lots of weights not put away and can be left all over the place. Looking a bit tired in places and some equipment needs refreshing. The good points are nice members, the size of the gym, free parking and the overall amount of equipment available especially when it's all working. Overall I still love the gym but there are a few frustrations.

I believe there is a manager now so hopefully things will improve again üôè
showerReviews.author: S W

showerReviews.reviewText:
For the price, its a very decent gym with a lot of variety of equipment! But, there are issues! In the men's changing room, there is only 1 cubicle toilet and 2 urinals! For the amount of men members that attend the gym, this is not enough! They should really think about getting more cubicles installed! 2nd issue with the mens changing rooms is that I think there is a drainage issue because sometimes it really smells like a used and abused toilet in there! 3rd issue with the mens changing rooms is that there are 5 showers and only 1 of them has a good water pressure! The other 4 have low water pressure! Another issue with the mens showers is that when you use furthest left or right shower, the sensors for the lights must not reach them as it goes dark quite quick and you can only get them to come back on by left the shower and the sensor picking up your movement! The showers could get a better clean too! There are also a lot of lockers which don't work!

Another issue is that most of the time, there is one or more bits of equipment broken and it takes a while until they're repaired! Considering that they have raised the money on quite a few occasions since it changed from Exercise for Less to JD GYM, they should really priorities getting equipment fixed quicker and to be honest, more equipment!

Another issue I find when it comes to the winter and the summer. They won't put any heating on over the winter and they rarely put the Aircon on over the summer.

I think if the price ever reached ¬£30 or more for a month, I would leave and find a new gym!
showerReviews.author: Travis Jones

showerReviews.reviewText: I saw they had a ¬£5 for the first month promotion. So thought I‚Äôd give it a go. Went there with my friend, the place is an absolute dump. Filthy equipment, music blaring, liquids and bottles spilled all over the gaff. Good selection of equipment but a lot wasn‚Äôt in good condition. The whole place is nasty. Went twice and I shall not be returning, even at a quiet time at 5am it still wasn‚Äôt worth it. I‚Äôm usually not fussed about showering at a gym, but this place is a no go zone. I can‚Äôt believe JD have attached their name to these abysmal location and equipment, disgusting. It wouldn‚Äôt surprise me if Covid originated from this disgusting place. If you go then wear a hazmat suit and take anti aids medication.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been a Member for a little over 3 months and love it. Equipment, while a little older than Pure gyms, feels great to use with a much heavier emphasis on weights rather than cardio like some other commercial gyms.

Love the boxing area a great way to unwind after a stressful day with a nice amount of bags for multiple people to use at once.

Sauna is fantastic and is a great way to relax after a long session at the gym as well as the showers are great especially with the cold shower allowing you to do a sauna then cold plunge.

Only issue I have is that equipment can be out of order for a long time and it's just due to general wear and tear from lots of use.

Even with the little issues I plan to keep going on a regular basis.
showerReviews.author: Dylan Warner (Swagmaster6676)

If the gym insists on taking on so many members then it must keep up with hiring more cleaning staff and providing more sprays and towels to clean equipment. There is none provided in the women‚Äôs section for members to wipe down their machines. The toilets are dirty with sanitary towel bins overflowing and the soap dispensers empty of soap most of the time. The hairdryers I doubt are ever wiped clean as they feel greasy to even touch, and the matts in the women‚Äôs area are often dirty and muddy. The gym is so busy even outside of peak hours, but if you do attend at peak hours, don‚Äôt expect to find any parking at all!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Now..... 15/02/24

Disappointed Decline: My Updated Experience with JD Gym

Ten months ago, I eagerly signed up with JD Gym, excited about the prospect of getting fit and healthy. Back then, I was genuinely happy with the gym and even left a positive review. However, things have taken a nosedive since then, and I've had to make the tough decision to cancel my membership and find another gym. Let me break down why.

First off, let's talk about the changing rooms and toilets for men. It's honestly a nightmare in there. The smell hits you the moment you walk in, and there's just no escaping it. It's like there's zero ventilation. The floors are always wet, the sinks are busted, the soap dispensers are always empty, and don't even get me started on the mess ‚Äì it's like nobody ever bothers to clean up after themselves. Plus, half the lockers are busted or missing doors, which is just inconvenient and makes you worry about the security of your stuff.

I want to give credit where it's due ‚Äì the staff are really friendly and helpful. They're always there to lend a hand or offer advice. But unfortunately, their positive attitude can't make up for the fact that the gym itself feels like it's falling apart. The equipment is getting old and worn out, and it seems like nobody's bothering to maintain it properly.

So, as much as I hate to say it, JD Gym just isn't cutting it for me anymore. The decline in cleanliness and the state of the facilities have made it clear that it's time for me to move on. I'll miss the friendly faces, but I need a gym that prioritizes hygiene and upkeep.

Initial review upon joining 10 months ago
===================================================
JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent place for fitness enthusiasts to work out. As soon as you enter the gym, you will be greeted by the modern and clean facilities. The gym is spacious, with plenty of room for everyone to move around without feeling cramped. The gym is equipped with a wide range of modern equipment, which is well-maintained and in great condition. This ensures that you will always find what you need to get a complete workout.

The staff at JD Gym are friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. They are always available to assist you with any queries you may have and are willing to listen to your feedback. This dedication to customer satisfaction is reflected in the gym's amenities, which include free parking for members, saunas, and showers. These extras allow you to relax and refresh after a workout, making your experience at the gym even more enjoyable.

In conclusion, JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent choice for those looking for a modern, well-equipped gym with a friendly and dedicated staff. With ample space, high-quality equipment, and great amenities, JD Gym is sure to meet your fitness needs.
showerReviews.author: Cyrus Wolf

I want to give credit where it's due ‚Äì the staff are really friendly and helpful. They're always there to lend a hand or offer advice. But unfortunately, their positive attitude can't make up for the fact that the gym itself feels like it's falling apart. The equipment is getting old and worn out, and it seems like nobody's bothering to maintain it properly.

So, as much as I hate to say it, JD Gym just isn't cutting it for me anymore. The decline in cleanliness and the state of the facilities have made it clear that it's time for me to move on. I'll miss the friendly faces, but I need a gym that prioritizes hygiene and upkeep.

Initial review upon joining 10 months ago
===================================================
JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent place for fitness enthusiasts to work out. As soon as you enter the gym, you will be greeted by the modern and clean facilities. The gym is spacious, with plenty of room for everyone to move around without feeling cramped. The gym is equipped with a wide range of modern equipment, which is well-maintained and in great condition. This ensures that you will always find what you need to get a complete workout.

The staff at JD Gym are friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. They are always available to assist you with any queries you may have and are willing to listen to your feedback. This dedication to customer satisfaction is reflected in the gym's amenities, which include free parking for members, saunas, and showers. These extras allow you to relax and refresh after a workout, making your experience at the gym even more enjoyable.

In conclusion, JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent choice for those looking for a modern, well-equipped gym with a friendly and dedicated staff. With ample space, high-quality equipment, and great amenities, JD Gym is sure to meet your fitness needs.
showerReviews.author: Cyrus Wolf

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is fine for what you pay and the hours it serves 247 especially in comparison to other local gyms. It does what it says on the tin and what you pay for. Good variety of machines free weights cables and plenty of squat racks. Missing machines they don‚Äôt have include assisted pull up/dips, laying leg curl, core machines. Also additional attachments for cable machines would be useful like a v bar.
When machines are broken they are fixed in a good amount of time.
Functional area for sled push included with variety of kettlebell.
Good array of cardio machines and a woman‚Äôs only section. Woman‚Äôs only section has all the old equipment and DB up to 10kg.
Member etiquette could be improved no one deracks and staff don‚Äôt bother cleaning up so you find equipment everywhere in random places can be really frustrating. Lots of young members with their tripods you often trip over their camera sticks.
Gym doesn‚Äôt provide any hygiene stations to wipe down or clean equipment.
Membership includes 2 hr free parking in the chimes takes about. 10 m to walk there and walk back. Come before 8am and you can park on the high street or outside.
Staff could definitely work harder in cleaning up, you often see the cleaning paper on the wall signed off with all the hours ticked off up to 10am slot when it‚Äôs only 7am.
Male bald head worker comes across quite creepy approaching all females and making unneeded comments.
247 toilet has been out of order this week which has been FOUL how can you expect anyone let alone a female no toilet space to urinate during a workout !
Toilets super foul see photo and this is ladies toilets? Other image shown staff lying about their checks and the times their signing off interesting DB signing off at 8:05 when it isn‚Äôt even 7am yet ?
Also some members have mad BO.

locations.title: JD Gyms Ipswich
locations.address: ÓÉà3, Suffolk Retail Park, London Rd, Ipswich IP1 2EJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined when it opened, along with my partner.

The gym itself is crowded with machines, the lighting manages to be both too dim (generally) and too bright (spotlights) simultaneously. The music is almost always too loud, so you have to turn your own music up to dangerous levels in order to hear it. The changing rooms/toilets aren't available 24/7, and finding smaller weights to add on is frequently an issue. The company is also charging me ¬£4 more a month than other members who signed up at the same time.... And refuses to tell me why.

However they have the best yoga instructor once a week.... If they leave, I leave.

Staff on site are generally pretty good.... I did have issues accessing the disabled facilities (you have to ask to be let in every time, because apparently having a disability makes you a naughty child?!), with one staff member looking me up and down and asking why I needed to use the disabled toilet.
showerReviews.author: Jennifer McCarthy

showerReviews.reviewText:
Facilities: 6/10
Staff: 9/10
Customer service: 2/10

JD Gyms are after short term customers and don't expect you to return.

The facilities are alright, considering it is 24 hour, the showers can get a little gross, but with the number of people using them, and the time of day I was using the gym, it doesn't surprise me.

I would notice sometime machines would stay in an unclean state for a few days in a row.

Anytime I interacted with the local staff, they were helpful and friendly. They were also able to bridge with the various gym personalities.

My problem with the company is their customer service. If you have a problem, they don't seem to try and resolve it. They won't treat it case by case.
You are not guided to the customer service, you must search for it, and even then, it is email contact only.

JD Gyms do not seek to retain customers, they just want to get what they can out of you whilst they have you.

Cheap local option, but not a great option.
showerReviews.author: Dommy .L

showerReviews.reviewText: The gym floor is good with a good range of equipment but it isn't looked after well. Things often out of order and very slow to repair. The main gym has been refitted quite recently but they've never done the changing rooms, showers or toilets and they are very poor. They are dirty and old and lots of the showers don't work properly and are often out of soap. There are often only one or two hairdryers working and I've complained at the gym and to their head office and they just don't care. They couldn't even bother to reply. Customer service  is very poor and it comes from the top down. It is cheap so I suppose you get what you pay for but it's been noticeably quite since Pure Gym opened. I've been a long loyal customer but it means nothing and they are tough over contracts so beware!
showerReviews.author: Marcus Broom

showerReviews.reviewText: Be careful when you sign their contract! I wanted to cancel my membership after six moths of going to the gym, due to the fact that the changing rooms, showers and toilet always looked very dirty. There was also something that looked like fungal growth in the swimming pool. However, their standard contract is written in that way that you cannot cancel your membership within the first 12 months of the contact! And they just do not want to hear anything.

showerReviews.reviewText: I joined here about 2 weeks ago.  Currently there are 5 machines broken, that is both cable machines,  both seated row machines and the lat pull down.  I was told by staff in the first week not to leave and that they will get fixed. This didn't happen so I went through to membership services to make a complaint and cancel.  They said I can't cancel because I used the gym too many times within the cooling off period. Staff and membership services all have the same poor attitude. In addition the toilets showers and the spa area are absolutely disgusting.  No soap or shower gel. Awful place

showerReviews.reviewText:
I seriously doubt the good reviews on here are genuine.  The gym is not well kept and is often dirty.  None of the staff seem to understand what good customer service is and don't understand their product (I wanted to know the date a class would begin and never found anyone who knew anything about the class despite it being advertised on the landing), they are rude and treat members like cattle.  Complaints/suggestions are ignored, opening times are changed with no notice, the pool is not cleaned (there was poo in one of the Jacuzzi‚Äôs for a lengthy period), classes are cancelled with no notice and are inconsistent, the swimming pool showers are theatrically blasted with a motorized cleaner every evening, which is so noisy it makes the wet rooms effectively unusable (surely this should happen outside of open hours?) and yet doesn‚Äôt make the facilities clean.  Finally, there is a young lady called Emma in a management position who really makes the whole experience awful; she talks loosely about gym members and staff in front of people and is mean; once she laughed and was critical about a gym members appearance and it made for a very uncomfortable experience.

Beware, they will be nice until you sign the contract - save yourself the hassle and join one of the many nicer gyms in Cambridge.
showerReviews.author: Sue Baker

locations.title: Roadchef Strensham M5 Northbound
locations.address: ÓÉà8, M5, Strensham, Worcester WR8 0BZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited today, I have been a few times to stop for a shower whilst on my 45 min break / daily rest. Waited 20 minutes to use the only female shower as it was in use. To my disbelief a man came out, I did ask him what he was doing in the only female shower when there were several male showers, he said a showers a shower & 'genders don't matter anymore'. This is disgusting, not only is there one shower for women, but its so easily accessible for anyone. Shower floods and the sink and toilet were an absolute state. Shower doesnt last long so you have to keep pressing it. I'm not going to lie it is probably one of the better showers ive been too however it's still not great. There is plenty of room to park & I like the variety of food outlets. However this experience is bad enough for me to complain about it. Around 1500hrs 17/7/25 I went to shower.
showerReviews.author: Lauren O'Shea

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here over night as a truck driver with my wife. Haven‚Äôt been here for six months, but it‚Äôs certainly gone down hill a lot for truckers.Half of the truck park has now been taken up by charging stations, leaving parking for a max of 30 trucks which are crammed in tight by 7pm, this definitely means damage will be done more often in here as trucks try to park and leave in the morning. The showers were actually cold! Not even tepid. Apparently there‚Äôs a problem with the water heaters! The bins inside were full and apparently the ladies shower very dirty and smelly. Needless to say we didn‚Äôt have a shower. Most drivers aren‚Äôt slobs and have a lot of self respect and a company to represent! Not easy when all we have is abysmal facilities like this. We were still expected to pay ¬£27 for the privilege of parking here! Maybe this is just one more reason the government can‚Äôt encourage more people into the haulage industry! Another parking area gone to pot!!!
showerReviews.author: Mark Welsh

locations.title: The Fellows House Cambridge, Curio Collection by Hilton
locations.address: ÓÉà33A Milton Rd, Cambridge CB4 1UZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Check in staff, very friendly and courteous. Impeccable service. We were assisted by Ms Cecille (maraming salamat po).

Room, comfortable & quiet. We all had excellent sleep every night. The mattress, ohhh la la, so so nice and comfortable.

Shower: good pressure and hot water was hot. Didn‚Äôt like the smell of the water in Cambridge (beyond the hotel jurisdiction, too hard water).

Parking rate is steep but is so everywhere else in Cambridge. Shaded underground and secure car park. Space is a bit tight, beware. Reverse park slowly.

Housekeeping staff, very helpful. We opted out but got fresh towels everyday.

Laundry, a life saver for us. Thanks. Salamat Po. Dryers didn‚Äôt work when we checked in but they got fixed the next day. 4 washers and 4 dryers. Bring own detergent. Time it and get our things out of the machines on time, so others can use them. Courtesy!!!

Several shops nearby, an Indian, Chinese food and a co-op (3-5min walk). Also a Hungarian restaurant.
Short walk to Jesus Green (7-8min walk).

Gym and swimming pool are there. Didn‚Äôt use, cannot comment.

We will def return to stay and wholeheartedly recommend to others. The management has got a very good team (TQ po).
showerReviews.author: H ‚ÄúPopo‚Äù Slim

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚ÄãI stayed at The Fellows House Cambridge for nine nights (the whole of last week and half of this week), and unfortunately, my experience was extremely disappointing and far below the expected standard for a Hilton Curio Collection hotel.
‚Äãüßπ Housekeeping and Cleanliness (Major Issue)
‚ÄãThe cleanliness of my room was unacceptable, especially concerning dust and hygiene:
‚ÄãExcessive Dust: There was a visible layer of dust on virtually every surface. If you suffer from allergies, I strongly advise caution, as the dust under the bed appeared to be accumulated years.
‚ÄãDirty Floors: The floor was visibly dirty and was clearly not hoovered during my entire stay.
‚ÄãDaily Service Failure: The room was supposed to be cleaned daily, but service was repeatedly missed. When I inquired at reception, the staff attempted to gaslight me, claiming the issue was my fault because I had pressed the "Do Not Disturb" button‚Äîwhich I absolutely did not. I had to call the front desk every single day to request basic room cleaning.
‚ÄãüçΩÔ∏è Poor Customer Service at The Folio Bar
‚ÄãThe staff at The Folio were consistently unfriendly and unprofessional, making customers feel like an inconvenienc. I ordered a quiche and politely asked for it to be warmed up. The staff member rudely asked, "Don't you have a microwave in your room?" He insisted I must have one, forcing me to repeatedly state that I did not. He finally complied, but his attitude was hostile.
‚Äã On another visit, the same staff member came in late and saw me waiting at the bar to be served. He finished serving the customer ahead of me and even engaged in casual conversation with me, saying, "Oh, I remember you." After waiting for approximately 10 minutes while he tidied up, he finally approached me and simply announced, "We are closed!" He clearly saw me waiting the entire time, spoke to me, and yet only told me they were closed after making me wait, sending me away empty-handed.
‚ÄãConclusion: This was, without a doubt, the worst hotel experience I have ever had. The combination of unacceptable cleanliness and hostile customer service made my stay extremely stressful.
showerReviews.author: Anna Druzga

showerReviews.reviewText: The guesthouse is okay for its price and George seems like a nice person, although we didn't interact with him much. The shower is shared with all the guests and, although it is not dirty, the repeated use throughout the day makes it an uncomfortable experience (very wet floor mat, etc). The mugs in the room were dirty and the kettle too. Overall it is a decent place if you're on a low budget. I'm just coming here to say that George discredits any negative review making up information you cannot disproof as you cannot reply to his comments. This has happened to us in a different comment, where the information provided in his reply was completely false, and now I suspect the same has happened to other reviews.

showerReviews.reviewText: Misled by Airbnb into thinking this is a private room in a home but turned out to be a badly-run guest house with a rude & pompous host. The shared bathroom looked clean at first but guests have to share a bath mat which got soaked by day 2. The hot water in the shower is heated by a small box heater attached to the shower head. The hot water ran out after I'd put shampoo on. Had to turn off the shower & stand in the cold for the heater to heat up more water before I was able to rinse off! There was no stopper in the room basin, resulting in my skincare bottle falling right inside the grain. I had misheard the check out time as 11am when it was actually 10am. George knocked on my door aggressively at 10:35am, inserting a door stopper as if he was about to clean the room when I was not even packed/dressed, declaring that he's an important person and I was making him late for a meeting. I finished packing in less than 10 minutes, yet he came back to order me to leave. This is by far the worst experience for any Airbnb or even guest house stay anywhere in the world. Airbnb removed my feedback only after half a day because I had unknowingly disclosed his job in the city, hence making him identifiable. This is why I'm reposting my review here because I do not wish anyone to make the same mistake.  AVOID AT ALL COST!!
showerReviews.author: Christine Leung

showerReviews.reviewText: Misled by Airbnb into thinking this is a private room in a home but turned out to be a badly-run guest house with a rude & pompous host. The shared bathroom looked clean at first but guests have to share a bath mat which got soaked by day 2. The hot water in the shower is heated by a small box heater attached to the shower head. The hot water ran out after I'd put shampoo on. Had to turn off the shower & stand in the cold for the heater to heat up more water before I was able to rinse off! There was no stopper in the room basin, resulting in my skincare bottle falling right inside the grain. I had misheard the check out time as 11am when it was actually 10am. George knocked on my door aggressively at 10:35am, inserting a door stopper as if he was about to clean the room when I was not even packed/dressed, declaring that he's an important person and I was making him late for a meeting. I finished packing in less than 10 minutes, yet he came back to order me to leave. This is by far the worst experience for any Airbnb or even guest house stay anywhere in the world. Airbnb removed my feedback only after half a day because I had unknowingly disclosed his job in the city, hence making him identifiable. This is why I'm reposting my review here because I do not wish anyone to make the same mistake.  AVOID AT ALL COST!!
showerReviews.author: Christine Leung

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place was pretty cheap, but pretty depressing.
Everything was grubby, by which I mean unclean. Light switches and door handles covered in dirt. The shower room was a study in mildew, with the dirt of ages in the spaces behind the doors. It's not often you feel dirtier after having a shower.
Of the two sets of plug sockets in our room, one had a non functioning plug and the other was loose in the wall. The bedding had a second hand feel to it, as did the cups provided for tea and coffee.
We did select on price and we were late in placing the booking. It's a lesson learned. I very much doubt we'll ever be back!
Two stars rather than one though, as the owner was friendly enough.
showerReviews.author: Ben Gray
