locations.title: Cambridge City Studios - Book Direct by Paym√°n Club
locations.address: ÓÉà26 Newmarket Rd, Cambridge CB5 8DT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: The room we had was fine, but certainly not the four stars that we saw here when we booked the room. Our room was a studio with a small kitchenette and a bathroom. The rugs in the main room were dirty and there were cobwebs in the corners. The paint in the bathroom was peeling and there was black mold in the shower. The kitchenette was fine though the trashcan was broken. It was stocked with plates and utensils, and even had a little espresso machine. Our room was below ground, and it seems like the spare keys for other guests were outside our door, so there were constantly people walking outside our door, which was unsettling. Also, checking in was terrible; we had to wait on the phone for a half hour on the day we were checking in to schedule a time for the person to let us in. They also sent us a contract to sign less than three hours before we were supposed to check in that had a bunch of extra fees we'd never heard of.  Overall, the room was decent and fine for someone younger who just needs a place to stay.  However, management does not take care of the room and is horrible to deal with.
showerReviews.author: Michael Saffron

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID
Extremely horrible experience. First at all I booked last minute but before booking I ask if they had ability for the two nights I wanted, they said yes when we turn up we had to wait outside in the cold for one hour to receive a text with checking instructions. Then it turn up they didn‚Äôt had ability for both days only one night. So we said ok that‚Äôs fine please cancelled the booking. They refused to cancelled and give us the money back. When we enter the room, there were not towels provided, no heating and the mattress soo old with the springs out and the toilet was dirty full of mold. At the end we decided to leave. We cancelled the booking but we never got any money back. Extremely bad customer service.
showerReviews.author: Diana Garcia

showerReviews.reviewText: I had a terrible experience here and left after 1 night. Firstly I was given two rooms, both were uncleaned. This violates covid policy. The rooms were extremely low quality with broken and dangerous furniture. The shower was unclean and extremely poor quality. Almost everything was poor quality for the price. The walls are paper thin and I was kept up all night by a noisy neighbour. In general felt unsafe in the property and leaving valuables there. Do not stay here!!
showerReviews.author: Justin Grace

showerReviews.reviewText:
Avoid, avoid, avoid.
The room was dirty, damp and absolutely reeked. There was no hot water and the bed was the most uncomfortable thing I've ever slept on it. You could feel every spring.
We had booked for three nights but left after the first night (luckily AirBnB returned our money as the room was nothing like the photos). Not worth the money at all, don't stay here.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall the apartment was okay, lacked a couple of necessities such as tea towels and sugar. Well, there was ONE sachet of brown sugar in the bowl of teabags and coffee.

We were assured it was cleaned before we got there but found a half empty bottle of water on the side along with cheese and milk in the fridge.

I went to iron a shirt with the steam iron but found it leaked water and there wasn't a cover for the ironing board.

Upon entering the shower I noticed that one of the rolling doors had come off it's runs, not a major issue but you would have thought it would have been checked.

They supplied us with a heater but no fan (and it got really hot in there!)
showerReviews.author: Danny Varela

showerReviews.reviewText:
Check in was a nightmare. On hold on the phone for 15 minutes before the company answered, then was called and harassed to ‚Äúhurry up‚Äù because someone was waiting to let me in. Turns out it was just two kids waiting on the front stoop. Took an extra $100 to protect the apartment - which would make sense if the apartment was in good or clean condition - it wasn‚Äôt. Peeling paint, no screens on the windows, you can hear your neighbors flushing the toilet. Trash can in the kitchen was broke.  The espresso machine came with only 3 pods for 2 people staying 3 nights (and 2 of the 3 were decaf!). I took a shower and within 5 minutes of walking around the unit my feet were totally dirty. There is little privacy in the unit because they installed the extra keys for all of the building‚Äôs units right outside of the front door - so in addition to being in the basement unit, you also have people coming at all times of day and night to collect their keys from right outside your front door (which is glass, see through, and looks directly onto the bed). Very disappointed with this ‚Äúdeluxe studio‚Äù. Don‚Äôt even want to imagine what their normal rooms are like.

Only pros: size, location, kitchenette
showerReviews.author: Lauren Helene

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked a studio flat which should consist of regular kitchen stuff too. But there was no microwave oven, fridge is not working, heater not working and TV didn't have remote, no dishwasher, bed was very bad where I faced a body pains every morning during my stay.
It made my holiday unpleasant. I don't to extend this topic further and I made decision not to book at peymans again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The worst customer service experience I have ever experienced in 5 years of travelling around Europe.
My family and I booked 3 apartments in the Cambridge city studios for 5 days (4 nights). We were asked to pay everything upfront and so we did. A week before I called the company just to check if everything was ok, every person I talked with by phone seemed to not enjoy at all what they were doing (but was fine, it can happen). Once we arrived we have been asked to pay a deposit of 300¬£, fair enough. The young man who welcomed us explained what we had to know and showed us the rooms. At the beginning seemed to be everything ok but after looking around we start to see things that we were supposed to find in the room such as slippers and towels. Straightaway we told the young man what we were missing (as we didn't bring them from home because they were supposed to be provided by the company and we used the space in the luggage for something else) and he apologised and told us that we were right and he was going to bring them to us, never seen him anymore, fine they are just slippers and towels isn't? we started to put our stuff and clothes away and we realised that everything was very dirty, two fingers of dust in the wardrobe, on the ironing board and on shelfs. The room n3 didn't have warm water from day one (fortunately we had other rooms otherwise no warm shower in October). We called straightway the number found on the website and spoke with someone who told us that was going to call a technician and was going to let us know. Nobody called us back and no technician showed up. This story it lasted for the all duration of the holiday. We called everyday and always spoken to someone different who didn't know anything about our problem (which means there is no communication at all between the staff) and all of them could barely speak English. This when I experienced the worst customer service, all of them were rude, unpolite (talking like it was our fault) and unhelpful and every time we were told that they were going to let us now and guess what? nobody did it. The third day the toilet in the room n5 got blocked and we were unable to unblock it due to the lack of a sink plunger. We called again but obviously with no results. After booking 3 rooms in the same building, paying all the amount months in advance plus deposit we weren't expecting much but al least clean rooms and some warm water! I will make sure that any person that want to travel and are looking for a place where to stay won't book with Paymans.
showerReviews.author: davide di girolamo

locations.title: CB1 - Student Accommodation in Cambridge
locations.address: ÓÉàashton house, Brookgate, Cambridge CB1 2BP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Please don‚Äôt even consider staying in this student accommodation. It‚Äôs consistently new problems on problems and I am really tolerant but I‚Äôve had enough. When I first moved in the room hadn‚Äôt been cleaned or inspected from the last person who lived in it. I found multiple pairs of underwear and socks  left behind, hair in the shower and they even left their used toilet brush which had bowel remains on itü§¢ That was not a big deal as I was cleaning the room regardless. The second issue was when the freezer stopped working and all my expensive meat went bad. I understand things like this can happen but my issue is I contacted the building maintenance and I never got a response which is really poor. My third issue with this accommodation is I haven‚Äôt got one full night of sleep since I‚Äôve moved in. There‚Äôs always loud music, screaming etc from students outside on the street at night. You would be better off sleeping in a nightclub. However that isn‚Äôt the main problem. There is a false fire alarm at 2/3/4 am every other night. I thought it would stop after the new year but it still goes on and I assume it‚Äôs from people smoking indoors. My sleep schedule is completely messed up from the loud extremely frequent alarms. It‚Äôs unbelievable the amount of times it goes off during the night, its become so frequent that nobody will exit the building when there‚Äôs an alarm which can be very dangerous in the case there is a real alarm. Now what really pushed me over my limit and made me write this review was an incident today. I was asleep in bed and unwell this morning and a lady who works in the building unlocks my door with no prior warning and tells me to put my shoes on and to follow her. I did so as I thought it was an urgent situation in the flat. I follow her to see she was moving in a new tenant with his mum into the flat and she was disappointed in the tidiness of the kitchen. I can definitely understand that as I am a very clean person and I always tidy after myself but I have been away for Christmas break. Therefore, I cannot control the mess of anybody else. With that said, I find it completely unacceptable to be brought in by myself into the kitchen and being told off and to clean as if I am in primary school. An email beforehand would have been good before I had someone unlock my room. I am not the only person who lives there I just happened to be the only one in my room and the place can get a mess quickly with so many other people using such a small space. I don‚Äôt think it has to be said but I am not the only one responsible and I always clean and this was not necessary for a ‚Äòfirst warning‚Äô. I feel extremely uncomfortable and embarrassed about this situation especially being made to come out of my room half asleep and being singled out and told off in front of other people. I don‚Äôt deserve to be treated like that, especially over something like a quick take out of the bins or hoover which I do anyway but as said I had been away. Her attitude to me truly caused me emotional distress. The accommodation hasn‚Äôt had any water for 2 days due to maintenance and given the state of the place from before I moved in such as silverfish infestations, my broken wardrobe door, lifting floorboards etc I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs the shard hotel for this to be justified although with the London rent prices this accommodation charges they seem to think so. A nice dramatic email with a bunch of threats before this instead of after would have avoided the incident completely!

Staying here has made me think maybe a 3 hour commute to uni isn‚Äôt as bad as I thought. Please consider ANYWHERE else to live. This place is a last resort, and not a good one. The staff and the quality of the accommodation for the price are very poor.  The only positive would be the location as it‚Äôs near to the train station and corner shops but there are plenty of other accommodation options very near anyway.
showerReviews.author: Miss Luna

locations.title: Riverside Inn
locations.address: ÓÉà8 Annesdale, ELY CB7 4BN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Small (7 room) guesthouse with spotless, well appointed but small bedroom. View directly onto blank brick wall opposite from rooms 6& 7. If you're looking for river view go for the other rooms but you may have slightly more noise from the nearby railway from those.  Staff a little grumpy but generally OK. Breakfast was OK. My main gripe is the extremely misleading rating is has managed to attain on Booking.com.  This is not a five star hotel. Do not be expecting. Restaurants, swimming pools, room service, concierge, valet parking etc. that normally constitute 5 star hotels. Not that any of these are mentioned in the listing. This is an excellent 3 star guest house. It is one of (if not the) most expensive in Ely - possibly because of the rating. It is therefore somewhat over priced for what you get. Still,  a very clean, warm comfortable if cosy overnight stay.
showerReviews.author: Peter Forbes

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hotel itself is lovely.  Really nice rooms, comfy beds and pillows, great shower over the bath.  Tea and coffee in the room.  Small but good breakfast choice.  Great location for the cathedral and shops and restaurants, situated right on the river

The reason I've marked it down for service is that there was a bit of an altercation with the lady who was probably the manager.  It was all done via the ring doorbell and whilst my husband wasn't aware there was a pin code for the door as I hadn't told him, he got out of the car to ask about parking as there were no spaces available outside and it wasn't really clear where we could park.  Had the lady just advised us that there was free parking in Ship Lane, a 2 minute drive away, then we wouldn't have got into the argument with her as she insisted on reading out details of the messages she had sent me prior to arrival but I was already aware of these details, I just wanted to know where the alternative parking was.  So instead of talking to me through the door bell and telling me to go into the hallway and look at the map to see where alternative parking was available, she could have explained it clearly and saved us all an argument and then she wouldn't have had to message me to tell me we had spoken to her using strong and inappropriate language towards her ( which we didn't, we were speaking among ourselves but she was still listening via the doorbell) and telling us to make sure we didn't speak to the breakfast staff in such a manner or she would be forced to stop serving us.

So - apart from that, we had a pleasant stay, it's a lovely hotel but beware of upsetting Lily!!
showerReviews.author: Carol Stacey

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cherry Hinton is a beautiful site situated in the old chalk quarry. This however came with some challenges.  There were steep inclines down to the pitches however the pitches were level so no levelling blocks needed. All the usual good Caravan and Motorhome facilities, with excellent less abled facilities too.   The wardens were very friendly and helpful.
The motorhome emptying point and fresh water were accessible but it was a little narrow and restricted and turning round was a bit if a shuffle, we don't have a particularly large motorhome , under 7m in length. We requested a pitch near the less able facilities and we were allocated pitch 7 which meant having to navigate a steep incline with a gate to get to the toilet and showers.  I was not able to use my wheelchair and had to be helped to the showers by my husband who had to wait for me so he could walk me back.  We realise that the allocations of pitches for less abled has become more and more difficult since the introduction of the tick box on the booking form and in future we will phone ahead and request a less able pitch so we can avoid the above situation.  I would like to point out that this situation is beyond the control of the wardens at Cherry Hinton and does not reflect on the excellent service we received from them.
showerReviews.author: Jo Treby

showerReviews.reviewText:

The facilities are good with a couple of shower rooms and a communal area if you want to get together with a group in the dry.

We loved it and hopefully back soon.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a lovely 4 night stop over the bank holiday. This is a small very level and well maintained certificated site (with an adjoining camping field). This is a very peaceful site yet very easy walk (pavement) to the village with shops and very friendly pub.

Mel the owner was very friendly ensuring all guests were happy and settled in a very unobtrusive way - and I think she must be one of the hardest working people ever!!

A very nice site and location with new wash up facilities, 3 toilets and shower all kept very clean.

A great place if you want to venture to Cambridge and beyond, or sit on site and listen to the birds singing. Will definitely return :).

Just returned from our second visit to Bounds, delighted to see improvements to the site including the installation of a second shower. Mel was equally as friendly, hardworking and happy as before. We stayed in the main field this time which offers large pitches and wonderful views, and with little light pollution gave some lovely displays of the Perseids meteor showers.
showerReviews.author: Rachel Jackson

locations.title: Cambridge Camping and Caravanning Club Site
locations.address: ÓÉà19 Cabbage Moor, Great Shelford, Cambridge CB22 5NB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Impressed by the friendly welcome by Martin.
Having only joined the club a week before arrival didn't have the correct app on my mobile. Guided by Martin on the app and showed membership after setting up on our pitch of choice (43)
Spacious layout.
Very clean shower  / wc block and the pot washing area. Note the shower block cleaned 10.30 to 12 noon.
Short walk to find number 7 bus into Cambridge. Good local store near the bus stop for essentials. Pleased to report my emergency essentials of Yorkshire Tea Bags are stocked in the site office / shop.
Fresh water supply points are limited, so not ideal if filling your motorhome tank.
Site would benefit with shared water access between pitches, especially the EHU ones.
showerReviews.author: John Cashman

showerReviews.reviewText:
A brilliant warm welcome from martin he showed us to our pitch cut a few brambles that were sticking out
Told us where the bus stop was into Cambridge the number 7
We visited the garden centre down the road very dog friendly food and water for dogs in the cafe too we had a nice scone jam and cream
They have some lovely stuff
The campsite is very flat brilliant pitches we were in the grass field pitch 158 no electric
A great pitch near to the water tap
the Dog  walk is very nice the way it's  layed  out one of the best I've seen on ccc sites
The toilets/ showers are spotless very clean
push button showers worked  a treat
It's easy access to this site not far from the M11 junction 11
There is a train track that runs over the back  but it never boverd me
a few planes and and choppers go over
Overall this is a fantastic site to chill out or vist Cambridge
There is a shop nearby  just past the bus stops to buy the essentials
showerReviews.author: steve witt

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely site very convenient for the bus into Cambridge or Saffron Walden, but spoilt by a horrible smell from behind the trees on adjacent land. (The site is down a lane called Cabbage Moor and the smell was like cooked cabbage!). We spoke to the warden who told us other campers had complained & the C&CC had reported the problem to the environmental agency.

If it wasn‚Äôt for the smell, it would be an almost perfect site, spacious flat pitches, clean heated loos & showers, convenient for the buses and a local convenience store, both within 5mins walking distance.

Sorry to have to give this such a low overall rating. If it wasn‚Äôt for the smell, I would be awarding it 5*

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a lovely spot!

A friendly and super-helpful campsite owner just made it! Simple, relaxed and peaceful site. Composting toilets are clean and well cared for. Excellent showers and a good supply of hot water. Woodfired pizza oven on a Friday evening, little honesty box shop for essentials. Highly recommended if your idea of camping is to switch off and chill out.

showerReviews.reviewText: It is a great campsite with lots of good walks on the nearby wetlands and the perfect amount of amenities. The toilets and showers are well kept, and the entire campsite is well designed. The town is a 30-minute walk away or a short drive.  There are great pubs nearby, and the campsite owner Tim offers canoe hire for some nice beginner friendly paddling on the river, which is a six minute drive away. A barrista sometimes comes on Saturday and Sunday for fresh coffee and pastries. We have been back twice and are still exploring the area. Definitely recommended!
showerReviews.author: Nate Matthews

showerReviews.reviewText: It is a great campsite with lots of good walks on the nearby wetlands and the perfect amount of amenities. showerReviews.reviewText: We had two wonderful visits this summer. Close to Nature Reserve and interesting villages. Great for getting our early teen and friends out of their rooms and enjoying the outdoors. Easily accessible from Cambridge via bike or busway as well as car. All the basics you need for the perfect get-away -from-it-all camping: loo, water (including lovely hot showers) and campfires. Facilitates clean and well maintained. Shop within easy walk. Flat pitches and access to shade.  Thank-you Tim & Emma.

showerReviews.reviewText: A perfect campsite. Situated at the end of what can only be described as the world's largest cul-de-sac (!), the location is perfect. Most cars passing were from the campsite, so it was exceptionally quiet. The compost toilets and showers are built to a very high standard and are very clean and looked after. Each pitch has use of a wood burner. Small shop selling logs, drinks etc with an honesty box or simple pay online. Tim, the owner, was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return as it's one the nicest campsites we've ever stayed on.
showerReviews.author: Alan Smith

locations.title: Fen End Farm & The Orchard Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉàOxholme Drove, Cottenham, Cambridge CB24 8UP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A Charming Stay at Fen End Farm
Fen End Farm in Cottenham is a delightful eco-campsite, just 10 miles from Cambridge. Nestled in an organic apple orchard, the serene setting with private pitches and glamping options like yurts is perfect for families and nature lovers. Host Amy‚Äôs warm, friendly welcome made us feel instantly at home. The clean facilities, including hot showers and compost toilets powered by renewable energy, were impressive. Kids loved the bug-hunting kits and safe play areas, while we enjoyed cozy campfires and the farm‚Äôs delicious apple juice and organic burgers. With its eco-conscious ethos and peaceful vibe, Fen End Farm is a gem for a relaxing, sustainable getaway. Highly recommend!
showerReviews.author: John Richards

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: A wonderful rural website, with great facilities and helpful friendly owners. We loved that cooking on camp fires was not just tolerated but encouraged in keeping with a strong sustainability vibe at this site. Toilet and washing facilities were spotlessly clean and supplied with very hot water and eco friendly toiletries. A useful cabin was also provided for washing pots and pans storing cold items and generally hiding if the weather outside is unkind. My partner loved camping in the orchard and being allowed to help herself to the apples, I think she left a few! Oh and the produce available please try it for yourself we certainly enjoyed our evening drinking the cider and eating the burgers.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Moore

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fen End Farm is a lovely campsite.  Pitches are amongst the trees of the orchard which makes them private and each has a firepit, with wood accessible to buy.  We were surprised to find a kitchen with wash up sinks and kettles as well as a table to eat at and games to play.  The composting toilets worked well and the showers were great.
Vicky was welcoming and helpful and we will be back.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This would have been 5 stars because they accommodated me and my dogs last minute and allowed for a late entry. Showers were good. It deserves 5 stars for that. I was very grateful.

But in the morning.... like 530am I was approached in such an aggressive manner by one of the other people on the site that it ruined the experience. It was my fault as my dogs were off leash briefly but they weren't out of control and they weren't bothering anyone. I said sorry immediately and put them on. My one dog was actually shaking after how aggressively we were approached about it, it just was not necessary. If these are long term tenants or the owners I'd honestly be terrified to stay here ever again....
showerReviews.author: Megaret Tannett

This is our first season on a seasonal pitch here at quiet waters. We have been really welcomed by Linda and Tony whom keep this site immaculately clean. The on site toilet /shower block is always spotless, and hot water is always on tap.
Quiet waters is exactly how to market this site, the managers take great pride in maintaining  this.
The static caravans are well equipped,  extremely clean and are in great positions to access the  river.
The local areas have great pubs, fabulous walks and  cycle routes .
Thank you Linda and Tony for making this place a great site and  allowing us to chill in a fabulous place.

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a first class site with a choice of accommodation, with lodges and pods as well as the usual motorhome and caravan pitches. The pitches in several different areas making it less of a big field setup. Fishing is the big thing and there are several areas to choose from all set in lovely countryside. The pitch we had was on Astra turf and fully serviced. I don't really like this surface but as a practical choice it works really well and we didn't have the usual mud patch outside the door. The electric is metered and you get an allowance for this and then pay for anything over this you use, which seems very fair. There is a cafe and bar onsite by one of the lakes. The reception staff were great and very welcoming and the shop well equipped. The only slight niggle was the showers. Although there was no 'button' to press and hold, they were electric and the water flow on any setting was poor. They were also perhaps not up to the standard of others we have seen at other sites. Having said that this really is being picky as it didn't spoil our stay, but with everything else being so good it seems worth providing feedback on this. A great place and for us as a fairly local site we will definitely go back.
showerReviews.author: michael lockett

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a first class site with a choice of accommodation, with lodges and pods as well as the usual motorhome and caravan pitches. showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked two nights camping on short notice. Sarah the receptionist and caretaker/manager got back to me via email and also left me a voicemail. The campsite is pristine. Mark the other caretaker/manger keeps everything looking tip top. The facilities are fantastic. Hot showers, clean loos. Washing up facilities with washing machines and tumble dryers also all clean. I was on the tent section next to the bottom fishing lake and it was wonderfully peaceful watching all the fisherman doind there thing. A big one for me too was being allowed to have a campfire going. Mark even offered me some extra logs and an axe and saw. Brilliant service and going the extra mile.
Loved my stay and would highly recommend. Thank you.
showerReviews.author: Glen Bowles

showerReviews.reviewText: Previous experience was okay, this time was very poor. The changing area absolutely stank of urine - to the extent that even in the swimming pool it was overpowering. It didn't help that no one had bothered to deal with the full nappy bins. The lifeguards were poor - the girl spent more time chewing her nails than watching the pool; the boy spent more time watching his female colleagues then watching the pool. Not to mention the (learners) pool was overcrowded.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Generally I lane swim 3 plus times a week.
Sadly over this year things have deteriorated. Lane swimming is adjusted for school holidays which is understandable, however there have been extra lanes put in that raised numerous complaints and made swimming difficult.
The showers are often cold or not working, only 2 general use private shower cubicles when they are both working.
The hot tub is also often out of action, no communication about how long repairs will take.
There is a booking system, but very few people use it, so lanes can get very busy.
The life guards themselves are generally polite and happy to help.
I do hope they improve, it could be fabulous.
showerReviews.author: Katrina Nobbs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had high hopes about this place from a friend of mine who used to attend before moving away. Decided to do a trial day to get a feel before committing to a membership and I‚Äôm glad I did. Communal showers that burn you and hardly any of them worked. And most are around the pool area, so no chance of showering properly after swimming unless you want everyone staring at you. Changing rooms were so dirty on the floors, used nappies shoved under benches and hair ALL over the floors in the changing room cubicles. They also split the main pool into 3. One third was being used for lifeguard training it would seem. 2 lanes for swimmers and then 1/3 of the pool left for everyone to try and squeeze into. I appreciate it‚Äôs the summer holidays and you try to accommodate everyone; however you could barely swim 3 metres infront of you without bumping into someone or getting splashed in the face consistently, the fact you can allow 80 people in there at one occasion with only 1/3 of the pool open for full use is insane and not safe. Maybe do your lifeguard training during a time where it‚Äôs not open for all members of the public? Didn‚Äôt even stay the whole hour, left within half an hour as far too busy and noticed multiple people did too. Clear signs to indicated no arm bands or floaties past a certain point but ignored by multiple people and lifeguards did nothing about it, so those at the deep end who are trying to swim safely can‚Äôt as they‚Äôre getting splashed in the face by kids or they‚Äôre all lined up round the deep end of the pool.
Needs seriously updating and managed correctly for safety. (This also includes lack of swimming availablity for primarily adults through each and everyday on the schedule too.) really disappointed as the membership fee is very reasonable, but can see that‚Äôs because they want everyone in there all the time. Hot tub was closed and steam and sauna rooms are very small, can barely fit 2 people at a time.
Not sure what the gym is like or other areas as I didn‚Äôt explore those options due to wanting to join primarily for swimming.
showerReviews.author: Holly Siggins

showerReviews.reviewText:
Jacuzzi been out of action for weeks but something even more frustrating is the waste of water from the taps in the toilets. They continue to run and waste our precious commodity. Taps will not turn off and the water keeps running. Have mentioned this for over two years and nothing done. Solar panels recently installed in car park to save energy but not interested in saving our water. Yet the showers only run for a few seconds. One excuse way back was that people had to follow the Covid hand washing rule and the taps had been set for an extended hand wash‚Ä¶..really!
Times are coming when our water will be scarce in this country‚Ä¶just a thought.

Awesome place it has many facilities for your health,wellbeing and fitness. It has GYM,Swimming pool,sauna ,steam bath ,yoga classes ,group cycling ,combat ,spa,kids Gym ,teaching pool or kids pool. They also offer swimming lessons by expert trainers . They also help in buying swimming accessories like swim googles ,swimsuits ,swim shorts ,float swim noodles,and float pads . Nice leisure center logo cups ,security locks etc..Well.maintained bath area post and pre swimming along with dressing rooms ,toilets ,drinking water facility ,waiting room/hall or area ,lovely reception staff to guide . Also a lot of guards monitoring the pools continuously . They help in using the pool with safety and guides the kids to not run on the wet floors and other safety instructions .Excellent and polite staff . Nice place for lifestyle ,fitness ,fun and many more . They offer Flexi annual membership ,Annual membership , on demand use of the pool and other facilities in the center. The great thing is they offer corporate discounts ,each premium membership can add up to 3 children with a minimum fee for the different ages 1¬£ to 3¬£ per month for unlimited pool usage . Having  membership really helps you to keep you fit and healthy . I strongly recommend this to try .
Please feel free to ask any questions if you have I will try  to answer at my best .Kindly follow me for more info and reviews.
Thank you
Jay

showerReviews.reviewText:
I use the Olympic-size swimming pool here, which is excellent and well maintained. At ¬£6.70 a session, it‚Äôs perhaps on the pricier side, but the facilities are very good.

My main gripe, however, is not with the venue but with some pool users. Please stop wearing perfume (or strong scents) in the pool. It‚Äôs unpleasant to smell and even taste while swimming. There‚Äôs a reason we‚Äôre asked to shower thoroughly before entering, it keeps the water clean and comfortable for everyone.

I‚Äôd love to see this rule enforced more strictly. A gentle reminder from staff could make a big difference to the experience for all swimmers.

locations.title: David Lloyd Norwich
locations.address: ÓÉàDrayton High Rd, Drayton, Norwich NR6 5DU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Let‚Äôs walk you through a day at the not so fancy David Lloyd club
Once you walk through the door ( if they manage to open on time) you would be very lucky if you get a ‚Äúgood morning‚Äù and you should feel even luckier if you get a nicely rolled towel. Usually the member of staff would roll a towel in front of you place it under the desk and hand you one from the plastic bag!
The not so clean changing rooms feel like a sauna, the aircon is non existent, showers dirty and moldy , buckets laying around because the ac is leaking for months, toilets dirty and bins full‚Ä¶ what a delight. May I add, having a hot shower is a gamble too.
Then we go to the gym, the famous gym, where 30% of the machines are not working for months. However you should feel grateful if they are being fixed after 3-4 months and are not just being taken away, never replaced and the space where once was a machine becomes empty and sad. Cable clips are like unicorns ‚Ä¶ can never find one, also cable machines are out of order as they failed the H&S, the rowing machines must be also broken for a year now. Don‚Äôt expect to see staff on the shopfloor checking if machines are working or if is clean, that would be way above their pay grade. Gym in general is small and basic.
Next stop, the luxurious spa! Don‚Äôt remember when it was the last time every facility in there worked, always something out of order. Steam room is not working for over a year now, is just a warm room, unless you put some water over the sensor then it becomes a torture room where the steam is so hot that it burns your skin, I guess some people are into stuff like this (each to their own). The hydro pool, again if you are into hurting yourself then that‚Äôs the best place, the numerous broken and missing tiles would do the trick!  The sauna is the only pretty decent thing minus the blood stains on the ceiling, not sure what‚Äôs the story there. Luckily I‚Äôve been watching Dexter and I can identify blood splatters!
Outside pool and jacuzzi barely open , clean and available. More sun beds have been bought recently however on sunny days they have been kept away because is funny seeing members sitting on the concrete floor. Lifeguards are such a delight to look at, you can really see the excitement in their eyes for being there. You also get counted like sheep, no problem there, however most times the numbers are wrong as nobody bothers to take it seriously.
Have I told you the spa was closed for 4-5 months to build a wall plus extra little bits ?!? I was convinced they were building the wall of china, but how wrong was I ! They also had the brilliant idea of removing the water fountain, is not like you need any water, water is so overrated! They also left us just with one shower, we all queue up like in the Covid days.
Anyway, the area is always dirty and staff walk right past litter and broken tiles without even looking at them. Once a light post fell and 5 different lifeguards passed it, looked at it and continued doing their thing, great initiative!
There was a flem all dried up right next to the hydro pool for a month without exaggeration, reported it on the day it happened, no actions until it became so dry that the water jets must have took it away. Also shows how often the pool area is being cleaned, yakes!
And you end your lovely visit by saying thank you on your way out and being ignored by the staff members as they are either not interested or too busy gossiping with their colleagues.
The manager is like a scaredy cat, nowhere to be seen. No matter how many feeeback forms you fill and request a call back you shall NEVER be contacted, even if you ask at the desk for the manager that would also be a big ask and will be told he will call you shortly, don‚Äôt hold your breath!
Customer services, again no hope! Not interested in what you have to say and will advise you to cancel your contract! See I would, if that wasn‚Äôt the only gym next to home and work! However new big boy gym is in town, let‚Äôs see how many people will stay!
showerReviews.author: Ioana Ursescu

showerReviews.reviewText:
Advertised as a premium facility with a pool, tennis courts etc, I was eager to join David Lloyds. However management of the building and facilities is a complete shambles, especially with cleanliness and maintenance. I attempted to end my membership within one month only to be told I need to complete my 'initial term' of 12 months. Customer service is seriously lacking regarding any complaints or concerns and even attempting to cancel your membership is met with a cold and generic response by the membership team, who can only be contacted through email! And you can‚Äôt cancel unless you can provide evidence of medical recommendation, redundancy or moving! I spoke to reception and unfortunately they can‚Äôt assist either‚Ä¶That said, reception staff were lovely, empathised and understood my complaint regarding the cleanliness in the changing rooms (showers have mould, the ceiling is leaking) amongst other concerns and also emailed the membership team regarding cancellation but alas, I‚Äôm locked in paying nearly ¬£90 a month for this! It‚Äôs a shame because staff are lovely who work on site, it‚Äôs the decision makers and external teams that are lacking, which in turn impacts the club and its members. But as long as the money keeps rolling in, who cares right?

In conclusion, if you like paying for more than what you get, dirty showering facilities and awful customer service (directed at the membership team) - this place is for you. I regret joining, at least PureGym is actually clean! They said that it was the first time they‚Äôve heard any concerns regarding the dirty changing rooms/facilities but judging by others who have reviewed, they absolutely have and still haven‚Äôt done anything about it. If customer service want to call me, please only call to cancel my membership, disappointing.
showerReviews.author: Natasha Tribe

showerReviews.reviewText: Terrible gym - the staff were advised by a manager called Elliot to cut padlocks and break into lockers that were there overnight and take people‚Äôs belongings and shove them into bin bags. Didn‚Äôt even have the decency and respect for people‚Äôs stuff to keep it in separate plastic bags, all the stuff got mixed in together leading to some of my stuff being taken by other people when claiming their belongings. The girls locker rooms had pieces of the cut up padlocks all over the benches and the floor making it a safety hazard. No notices up on the walls in the locker rooms or outside or emails to say they were going to empty the lockers. Took me over 30 minutes to get my stuff back because there was no staff in the gym at 5pm when I discovered what happened. Disrespectful to peoples belongings and their privacy.

showerReviews.reviewText: I cant say anything bad about the venue as the website was making it hard to even book. Been trying for 15 mins just for it to say my booking is in a cart which seems non existent on the page. I tried on my desktop then my phone then my partners phone and still having couldn't find it. I tried to book the same slot but kept running into errors as I have already got in my cart which doesn't exist. I have tried everyway to try and find the cart but none at all. finding the cart should not be this hard to find, it should take a second to see where your purchase is. Me and my partner are now having to look around for other private swimming pool to become a routinely visit just because how the cart option either not existing or being extremely hard to find. Like I said cant fault the venue it looks really nice but the fact that the cart option doesn't exist or is really hard to try and navigate has now made us go elsewhere. Is a shame as the venue looks really nice.

locations.title: Beccles Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàPuddingmoor, Beccles NR34 9PL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely 30m pool, heated to around 28¬∞ during the summer season. We booked in advance on the website for an early morning lane swim as this is a popular pool and sessions can reach capacity. The pool is fairly wide (about 16m), with 4 lanes (slow/ medium-slow/ medium-fast/ fast) which work really well as there is plenty of room to swim breaststroke and even overtake within each lane. There is also a smaller pool for younger kids. The main pool has a small water slide, plus a low diving board, which are open during the casual swim sessions. Staff are friendly + 2 attentive lifeguards at either side of the pool. There is limited free parking at the pool, but there is an additional free car park along the road. There are traditional changing cubicles, which are clean, warm outdoor showers, and a relatively new toilet block. Lockers are available (¬£1 refundable), and there's a small tuck shop on site. Definitely a pool worth visiting ü§ó
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow, what a brilliant place to visit. I was really impressed and will definitely visit again.
The pool is a really good size and it's busy but not over busy. It's a heated outdoor pool so it's a good temperature.
There is also a spring board which is great fun.
We had some chips which were good value and a decent price.
Next time we'll aim for a double ticket  so we can try the inflatable too.
Around the pool there are sunbeds and some umbrellas but we took our own chairs as well as it was busy around the pool.
There are changing rooms (outdoors ) which were clean and dry and the toilet facilities were clean and well looked after.
We used the meadows parking which was worth it .
showerReviews.author: Adam Bevan

locations.title: Living
locations.address: ÓÉàNR2, 62 Bethel St, Norwich NR2 1NR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing this review for a young girl whom from no fault of her own ended up in this medieval rats nest‚Ä¶ I personally saw pictures and video of the room she was given‚Ä¶ placing a young vulnerable person in a what only can be described as a former store room or meeting room‚Ä¶
The door was a fire door with glass,
The glass had been covered up with scruffy paper that people had painted over I can only presume,
One paper patch had a hole  in it and someone had stuffed a mask in the hole to get privacy maybe!
A book shelf rammed with dusty books which was I presume wonky and didn‚Äôt stand firm hence the plastic bags on the floor wedged underneath,
The spring loaded metal mickey bed that stunk of urine,
The spare plastic covered mattress stuffed under the bed
A stack of around 6 desk chairs in corner of room,
Paint brushes on the floor from previous occupants,
Chocolate wrapper's left around,
Takeaway boxes
Someone‚Äôs clothing in Asda bags left behind
Towel left in room with stains
The previous occupants must have liked there talcum power as it was around the room,
Not even a tidy up had been attempted let alone a clean,
How the government agencies put people let alone young people in disgraceful accommodation like this in this day and age is shocking,
Staff at the ymca maybe friendly however managing cleanliness and common decency  is far from your skill set‚Ä¶
By the above description you know what room this is don‚Äôt you ymca ‚Äú manager ‚Äú ?
( New broom sweeps clean ! )
‚Ä¶king animals
I have pictures and videos of this if anyone gives a shit‚Ä¶ I doubt it‚Ä¶
showerReviews.author: We are not alone

showerReviews.reviewText:
What an amazing place, it's such a lovely place a nice greeting shown where everything was and extra wood was ready in the sauna. Beautifully quiet until we went in the swimming pond which was cold and we might have been about loud üòÄ the plunge pool was colder but fantastic to get back into the sauna.

This place is lovely if you like outdoors nature which i found heaven. If you like clinical and polished and hot showers you will not like this place but then why would you look at a sauna in the woods.

I spent two hours with a friend, it went do fast I would love to book the whole afternoon there.

Lovely section of herbal teas, I do apologise I was to sure why to put the used tea bags i probably missed where to put them.

showerReviews.reviewText: A wonderful spot - and way more tucked away that it looks on Google maps! The heat from the wood burning sauna was so relaxing, and we even braved (ish!) the tranquil natural pool, and plunge pool and cold shower. The changing bus was so handy and amazing - we were there for and hour and it felt like a proper relax - could easily spend longer there just enjoying the serenity.  Fabulous!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic rustic sauna, great experience and setting in the woods. The wild swimming pond is a great start to the sauna, which we managed to get to 95C with some extra wood the owner kindly brought over. The next guests were late so we ended up having nearly 2 hours for the price of one with no pressure to move on once our hour was up.

We'll be back!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just came back from our first and definitely not last trip to the Sauna In The Woods. What a brilliant ideaüëèüèº
Easy to book, easy to find on Google maps and even easier to enjoy the warmth/heat in the tranquility and peace of this location. Great choice of ‚Äúcold shockers‚Äù to get your immune system buzzing: cold shower which runs drinking water so bottles can be refilled from the tap as well, cold  bath and a natural pool for the brave ones:-)
There‚Äôs an old bus serving as a chill out and changing area. The outside lights come on when it gets dark so it all looks great too as well as you feel you are not that far from civilisation:-)
There is a choice of a few different essential oils to throw on the hot stones which makes it a whole different experience and a nice touch as a little battery powered light ball so it‚Äôs not completely dark in the sauna itself as there‚Äôs no light inside.
There‚Äôs enough wood provided to keep it hot at around 100C*. We‚Äôve spent two hours getting hot and the plunging into the cold bath so the only thumbs you have to worry about is being careful and using the heat glove provided for obvious reasons. Hope all the above helps those who are not sure about this place or experience. Oh, nearly forgot, there is a compostable toilet right next to the sauna so need to worry about flushing or blockagesüòâ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Would go there tomorrow again had they had availability so I guess it will be in the new yearüòè‚ò∫Ô∏è
showerReviews.author: ButterSound

locations.title: Float Norwich
locations.address: ÓÉà66-70 Ber St, Norwich NR1 3EW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable about all the therapies that are offered. Very informative, before, during (Cryo) and after. You are well looked after here! Your safety and comfort are of the utmost importance. Cryo therapy and sauna, were great! You can connect to the sauna to listen to your own music, there is a shower in the private sauna room for you to wash off after, with shampoo, body wash and conditioner. Soft towels! Hair driers are available, however we did not use them as it was a very hot day when we attended. We will be there again soon for floats! I will then update my review!
Returned for our floats! What a GREAT experience, I can't wait to float again!! I found the experience very relaxing. I floated with the lid closed for a while then with it open and lights out. Before you get in the tank, there is a cup of water, goggles, vaseline for any little cuts you may have to stop them stinging when you get in, there is a spray bottle of water and a flannel in the tank with you incase you get salt in your eyes (very helpful), just don't drop your flannel or leave it in the water as it can block the filtration system. The music wasn't the best (rain forest tune). The tanks are big, plenty of room, with a shower in your room for after, to get rid of all the salts. Soap, shampoo and conditioner is supplied, they smell lush!
I used the massage chair before my float, this was not too bad, not for me though, was rough on my left leg (I was warned about this beforehand as others have said it's a bit too much on your legs), the chair massages your back, arms, legs and feet. It wasn't bad, just wasn't for me.
I highly recommend Float in Norwich! A very welcoming, relaxing and informative environment. I will be returning!
showerReviews.author: Charlotte Utting

showerReviews.reviewText: Just come out of my very 1st float session...well what can I say. Amazing experience! Ive never felt so relaxed and it was so lovely to just float and not feel the weight of my baby bump. Ben was so helpful and informative and went the extra mile to make sure I was comfortable and safe by adding towels on the floor so I didnt slip (non slip floor but he wanted me to be extra safe) a lovely pillow for in the pod. Everywhere was so clean. The pamper room had all the necessities even a defuser for my curly hair. I will definitely be coming back again. Thanks so much.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Firstly, the gym is situated in a prime position at the South of the city in a retail park. There is plenty of parking but have to park further away during busy periods.

Inside, the design is great and there is a wide range of equipment. The equipment itself is mostly made up of the current Life Fitness and Hammer Strength, most of this is very good, and is far better than the offerings in rival commercial gyms.

There is a sauna in each changing room and this is a great addition considering the low monthly cost of just ¬£20.99 a month. The changing rooms themselves are quite small for the size of the gym and don't feel the most sanitary, they are also very hot due to the sauna.

Unfortunately, a low monthly fee and offerings such as the sauna mean this place is extremely busy, even during weekday evenings past 10pm and weekends. There are far too many members even for the size of the gym, at peak times, it is near impossible to get a good workout in. There are duplicates of some machines, but this is still not enough. The gym either needs to pause new members joining or add more equipment, there is so much more empty space they could utilise. They need two more smith machines, extra lat pulldowns and duplicates of popular equipment such as the Pec Fly and Incline Hammer Strength Press, and a couple more cable stacks. This would greatly improve the experience of using the gym.

Despite the above, they have made a few improvements from December 2023 to now, which includes slightly improved cleanliness of the changing rooms, and additional weight trees, but more needs to be done.

Overall, this gym is definetely worth it if you plan to go at like 10/11pm or during the day or weekend, but I would look elsewhere if you like going after work at 6pm.
showerReviews.author: Dan Weatherley

showerReviews.reviewText: Cannot rate this gym highly enough! I joined back in the summer after finally deciding to get in shape, I had a few PT sessions to build up my confidence and now I am absolutely loving it. Great space, got all the equipment I could need. Always really clean and tidy, great changing facilities too so perfect to get in a morning workout before work! Really handy to have 2 hours free parking at the building as well. Wouldn't go anywhere else now and would recommend it to anyone wanting to get fit, never over crowded or having to wait around to use equipment like other similar priced gyms in Norwich.

locations.title: The Gym Group Norwich Sweet Briar
locations.address: ÓÉàUnits 2-3, Sweet Briar Retail Park, Norwich NR6 5DH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited this gym late on a Sunday night using a promotional code to gain a free day pass.

There was plenty of parking at my time of visit, and entry into the gym was easy.

The gym was very clean and tidy throughout. Lots of equipment split into many different areas. Please see details of equipment below.

Brand: Matrix, Primal, Origin and Bootybuilder

Free weights up to 50kg, many duplicates for busy times. 2 Smith machines, 6 cable Pulldowns in addition to some machine Pulldowns, 4 Seated rows, 8 dual cable stacks, plate loaded upper and lower body equipment, hack squat, pendulum squat and other squat machines. 2 Smith machines, 4 flat benches, multiple incline and decline benches. Large Hyrox/crossfit area, dedicated glute training area, duplicates of pin loaded matrix machines, some less-common Primal plate loaded kit which felt really good, I loved the Bicep Curl and Smith row. Lost count of the number of squat racks! Large cardio area but doesn't take up 80% of the whole gym some like commercial gyms. Also, lots of great attachments including genuine MAG grips for Pulldowns and even fat grips (very rare for a commercial gym to have these!).

Only issue I encountered was I had to hunt for 20kg plates, there's enough but they were scattered everywhere, but this is usual for a commercial gym.

Changing rooms and toilets good, bring your own padlock for the lockers. Showers looked clean. Free water available, vending machines, seating area etc. Good lighting throughout the gym and the gym was a comfortable temperature.

Music terrible like 90% of gyms, but I'm a headphone user so not a problem for me!

Overall a fantastic place to workout, tons of equipment and lots of duplicates for busy periods. Great value, highly reccomended. Better than other Gym Group and Pure Gyms that I have visited. Pleasantly surprised as I'm not the biggest fan of commercial gyms.
showerReviews.author: Dan Weatherley

showerReviews.reviewText:
I need to start this review with a negative. Minor to some but it's big deal to autistic me.
I use the gym almost every day and have seen a huge increase in teenagers using the changing rooms as a social area. This really needs adressing.
There's sometimes 4 of them spread right down the benches blocking the lockers talking and playing on there phones for 30 minutes whilst others are in and out and stripping off to shower. It's really uncomfortable and it's really starting to stress me out.

The gym has a fantastic array of equipment. I rarely have to wait for anything.

The gym is clean and well maintained.

Despite the changing room issue I would recommend this gym.
showerReviews.author: James Cooper

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visiting, purchased a package deal on spa seekers website, which was great. We paid ¬£90 for 2 of us, which included 20 min back massages, 2 little bottles of procceso and unlimited use of spa facilities, like sauna, jacuzzi and swimming pool. Changing rooms and showers were in good condition. Swimming pool area more busy, no seperate pool for children so adults are together in one, there's a seperate line across pool, made for better swimmers, if I understand correctly. Only 2 saunas, very busy, hard to get a spot in ordinary sauna, steam one was less used. Also not rules of using towels or providing seat pads in saunas so you don't sit on other people's sweaty spots. Also no limitation of how many people are allowed to go in at once.
Cafe area is spacious, food is very cheap, but simple, ran out of eggs and avocados, which was around 12pm, but gave us discount on other food. Overall a nice place, definitely recommend
showerReviews.author: Jovita L.

If you‚Äôre new to fitness, there is a reason why people stick around, and if you‚Äôre experienced, you will learn something new and will test yourself. The gym itself it well equipped with good-quality kit and the shower facilities are gorgeous.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited this gym from 13/8-17/8 2025 using a 5 day pass, while I was visiting my parents. This is a good gym; it's not super new but it is clean. There is a lot of equipment for HIIT, cardio machines and a small weights area.

I had two flaws: 1) There's no cleaning spray and cloth to wipe down machines or benches, so I recommend bringing your own towel; 2) There are only 2 squat racks (one of which where you can deadlift), 1 barbell bench press, 1 smith machine. At busy times it is likely extremely difficult to use these items without waiting. On each of my sessions I was attending ~6am so it was fairly quiet. There are 3 (or 4 can't recall) cable trainers and a dip station. I was nicely surprised that there were some bands for stretching.

In terms of access and purchasing a 5-day pass, it was all very smooth. I was given a code to open doors and had no trouble.

Summary: Solid gym, good for holidays/trips to Norwich, probably a bit small for a regular gym, unless you're attending very early in the morning.
showerReviews.author: Michael A

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've tried the gym in a few different cities, and unfortunately, Hall Road is at the bottom of the list. The equipment is decent for the space, but that's about where the positives end. During both morning and afternoon peak hours, it's almost impossible to get a good workout in‚Äîclasses seem to take up all the free space, even when only a couple of people show up.

Additionally, the toilets and showers are consistently unsanitary and have a foul smell, which makes it hard to feel comfortable after a workout. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend bringing inexperienced friends here either. Some of the staff don't appricieate helping others unless they're getting paid for it.

Overall, the gym has potential, but the poor management of space, lack of helpful staff, and cleanliness issues really let it down.
showerReviews.author: Aleksandra K

showerReviews.reviewText:

locations.title: SNAP
locations.address: ÓÉàHead Office Commercial House, Laundry Ln, Blofield Heath, Blofield, Norwich NR13 4SB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Taking the hassle out of HGV parking and washing. From a drivers point of view, I don't want to be paying out ¬£30/¬£40 per night to park a lorry and lay there feeling anxious about the security of a load that doesn't even belong to me. I want to be safe and go home to my family at the end of the week with my full wage and not having to wait anywhere between 1 week and 6 weeks for those expenses to be paid back. SNAP have created a service that looks after every part of parking that we hold important. They consult truck stops on security and how to keep our loads and us safe when we are sleeping. They facilitate a payment method that doesn't leave me out of pocket and awaiting expenses to be paid back and they act as a champion for HGV drivers, taking the feedback we give them and bringing it to the attention of the truck stop owners.
Their social media presence is also something to check out. SNAP are always engaging with drivers from all sectors, giving shout outs and praise to those who would otherwise be overlooked.
My experience with SNAP has been nothing but positive.
showerReviews.author: TheGoose47

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely amazing place. Yes it's get full fast, yes it's on a slope  in some places..... but.... food is absolutely winner 10/10

Top price (as you have a few options) is ¬£35 with ¬£12 food voucher. Other options  are for ¬£6/¬£31  and so on. ¬£ 12  feed you everything  from menu apart from fully monty grill  ¬£15.95
Food menu is massive,including  burgers,curry,kebabs,home made pizza sandwiches  and so on. Food is awesome!  Trucker next to me said they try to kill you with the size of those portions. I saw different  platters out and all was great and when ask all said amazing. So a big shout out to a kitchen staff!

All place  very clean and tidy, don't forget to take token for a shower(7min plenty enough)  shower  room with massive space and regulated temperature of water üòéüí¶üòç so in summer - winner.

Staff mostly  very friendly  and kind, one bad egg but it might  be not his day so I won't  blame or judge  his life  on that. We all had it.

If by any  chance  I will be around, even  for a sneaky 45 I will be there!

I would recommend it 100%
showerReviews.author: Robert Pietrucik

showerReviews.reviewText:
A much needed facility where hundreds of lorries operate daily, servicing the massive port. Have the local councils done anything about providing lorry parking? Err, no! But private enterprise has! So that's a big thank you from me!
Parking is tight, but if you can reverse properly, you'll get a trailer in! There is only one shower, so you could be waiting a while. As far as food, there is a snack van. The Chinese takeaway just over the railway level crossing will deliver or walk up to the seafront for fish and chips. Maybe call for a pint in The Dolphin!
Look at my other reviews to see where I've been!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Thankfully I have time to move on and I didn't have to pay myself ( company pays snap ) , if you have to start at night good luck getting out of your spot, distance between your spot and the one in front is less than a trailer length, showers are paid, if you get here early they dont open till 12, long walk to a cafe.

Noise!! , train line behind, container yard at side ( skel trailers bouncing along a rough pothole entrance ) which I admit the park owners cant help that... but a mobile truck wash driving round the yard with a compressor and jet wash loud enough to wake the dead??!! , not a one off as the service is advertised

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a delivery to and collection from ipswich the next day. There are no other snap parkings around , and I'm grateful for that, because at least I could spend my afternoon  on the nearby Felixstowe beach ,which is five minutes walk away . All the Seaside attractions included.

When getting there, don't Mind the restriction - it's except for access , and you do need to access a lorry park.

When parking, and your artic is longer than ususal, be careful not to hit the wall in the back. Some spaces are too short for longer artists and the wall is nice, new, and litten up. See pictures.

The showers are paid extra ¬£3.

There is a shop and a caf√©. The place is simple, quite small but sufficient, modern , and has everything you might need for your stay in the area.

I hope I'll visit again soon and wish you best of luck for years to come.
showerReviews.author: Robert Baxter

showerReviews.reviewText: I've never had such a bad customer experience anywhere, like I had 2-3  weeks before there. I wanted to use the jet wash, but on of the staff started to shut with me because (he said) that I stood on the wrong place with my car. I told to him okay, but then give me back my money what I dropped into the jet wash machine. He said I can receive that in the shop. When I started approaching the building he shouted after me to move my car first. I turned and moved my car. Then he came to me with my money and remarked in arrogance that he would not help me next time. What kind of help? No chance for that next time buddy. Never again BP.... Sayonara! I went to the Shell which is much better!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stopped off here for a bite to eat, in our motorhome.
Although it's a truckstop car's and Motorhomes are welcome here.
If you want to stop overnight during the week you would have to pay the HGV rate, which is around ¬£23. At weekends the price is negotiable, although the cafe isn't open, but there are still toilets, showers and 24 hour security.
Everything was very clean.
The food was good home cooked meals, which were huge and piping hot. I had the special sauagemeat and sage pie, with mashed potatoes, cabbage, carrots, peas and gravy, plus 2 slices of bread and butter and a mug of tea, lovely.
showerReviews.author: Elizabeth Jackson

locations.title: Welcome Break London Gateway Services M1
locations.address: ÓÉàJct 2, Welcome Break, Gateway Services M1, 4 Mill Hill, London NW7 3HU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It‚Äôs the last chance, or the first I guess, to  have a wee, get fuel, food, papers or just a coffee on the M1 Motorway. I didn‚Äôt used to like it much because the potholes were big enough to take your tyre of its rim and I dread to think how many were and how the Miriad of delivery mopeds coped. The certainly didn‚Äôt need traffic calming measures but guess what? They had the biggest road humps I think I‚Äôve ever seen.
Anyway thank the gods all those problems have gone. Tarmac is good and smooth and the traffic humps are normal. The most used part of the services are always the toilets and these are placed through the front entrance and down to ,the right. There is a Game Zone on the corner. Due to it being just below ground level the are both a few steps and a ramp for the less mobile of us. Toilets are fine with the weird Dyson hand driers stolen from scooter handlebars but they work great despite that. Coming out of the ‚ÄúLoo‚Äôs ‚Äú there is a Waitrose and then WH Smith‚Äôs on your right and then round to the left you have Subway and then Burger King. To finish the food and drink there is a Starbucks as you come in the Services entrance who have a sit in and an outside seating area for when it‚Äôs nice weather. Outside there is a washing machine pod where you can wash upto 20kg  (or so the sign says).
There are 24 Tesla superchargers then 4 Grid serve chargers by the walkway to the entrance and all round the outside left of the car park (with your back to the entrance) there are 24 charging points, but I‚Äôm not sure of the company who operates them,
showerReviews.author: Bobby Dazzler

locations.address: ÓÉàJct 2, M42, Redditch Rd, Alvechurch, Birmingham B48 7AU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A nice convenient pit-stop while travelling, with a large car park for the coaches. The place is very bright and colourful. The üöª toilets are on your right as you enter. The ladies is very large with lots of cubicles. Its quite clean, though I don't think you can keep it spotless when used by dozens of women and hour. Theres various eating cafes to choose from with numerous drinks, either from the cafe or a machine. The turnaround is quite quick so you're in and out if the coach is leaving after you've been to the loo. Or there's seated tables to eat a full meal as well as benches along the wall for resting. Its also a gift shop, so be prepared to be assaulted by merchandise as soon as you go in. But its quite expensive too, I'd save your money for the trip you're on. Staff are efficient, though young and bored looking. Theres dozens of these stops along the motorway and all identical to the girl chewing gum.
showerReviews.author: Linda Cross

locations.title: Norfolk County Council Adult Social Services
locations.address: ÓÉàCounty Hall, Martineau Ln, Norwich NR1 2UA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely appalling service, grandmother been officially diagnosed with Vascular Dementia and they treated her like an average elderly woman with sound mind who seemed only slightly forgetful. Anyone who knows what Dementia and Alzheimer‚Äôs entails there is a lot of complexity that comes with it and gets worse not better, in my grandmothers case she is in denial that there is anything is wrong with her and lies out of pride or fear etc or doesn‚Äôt know what she is saying at all in most cases or makes sense. The social worker didn‚Äôt take it seriously enough in my eyes and the carers were a waste of time as they literally did NOTHING other then get her up, make her tea, give her meds. Grandmother is delusional she says she is independent but in reality is not.
She has all the typical signs and behaviours of Vascular Dementia and they seemed oblivious to it scoring 0 on her care needs form.
A male carer came in which I thought was off, grandmother has dementia and carers were assigned to wash and dress her and having a male do that with a woman with Dementia isn‚Äôt right in itself, i personally don‚Äôt think so. Yes in hospital male nurses is different but you catch my drift.
She gets very disoriented most of the time especially when waking up any time of day, suffers hallucinations, paranoia and delusions. Lies, is always agitated or anxious, does other strange things which is very dementia related. I have researched a lot and obviously more knowledgeable then adult social services which is a joke in itself.
Not taking struggling family into consideration at all, offering no support for us to help with the situation we are in.
And funny fact we have security and nanny cameras to prove this.
Absolutely disgraceful.
showerReviews.author: Tia Radakovich

showerReviews.reviewText: Warm welcome by the reception team. The room was located at the end of the corridor and it was quiet. Initially thought the room felt clean but then I spotted the grime in the shower that ran down the sides of the shower into. I wiped a small area and the result was gross. I expect better than this at a IHG hotel. It does not take a minute to wipe down a shower after guests have left.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Paid for a better room and so far on my tours of UK, it was 2nd best I've stayed in(room109)
Downside was after a shower, fancied a beer and found glasses over all bar taps and no draughts available other than Camden lager(not a fan)
Big disappointment as left only 330ml bottles at silly price.
Due to this,  didn't stay and order food.
In the morning, tried bfast and no black pudding, mushrooms, fried egg.
Scrambled was there, so made a bap rather than having English Breakfast.
Big disappointment after having to feed elsewhere.
Again, room, parking, staff excellent.
The need to leave site and go elsewhere, left me unsure if I would return.
showerReviews.author: Adrian

locations.title: Yoxford House
locations.address: ÓÉà31a St Stephens Rd, Norwich NR1 3SP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Our stay at yoxford house was as close to sublime as you can get at the height of a pandemic! Ginger & gold hosted us as I am a key worker. From the first conversation and throughout our stay no issue was too small for Liam to help us with. Everything was perfect- and there were so many lovely homely touches. The kitchen is awesome & such an inviting space to be in (I miss the fridge & dishwasher!). The giant bed upstairs was just the best and all the rooms are cosy. The whole property is so well presented and the location being so central was nice and will be even better now the town is open. Loved the open deck too - nice to watch the world go by from. Will definitely book through ginger and gold again!
showerReviews.author: Megan White

showerReviews.reviewText:
I rate the rooms at 4 stars to catch your attention that at All Hallows they are not "ensuite" rooms.  There is a sink, but toilets and showers are down the hall.  I knew this, it wasn't a surprise or a problem for me at all... but not everyone likes that arrangement.

The room was clean and neat and very usable for my needs; bathrooms were clean and close.  Access to kitchen was great and a continental breakfast is offered - some source of protein like boiled eggs would have been awesome - but overall it was a great place to stay.  People were great.  Access to the Julian Church & Shrine is literally right out the door.  15 minute walk to Norwich Cathedral and city centre.  It was perfect.
showerReviews.author: John Roberts

showerReviews.reviewText:
Liked
Beautifully kept grounds! It's not a boring field. It's separated into two different sections. One is flat and near the showers/flushing toilets, and the other one is more sloping but is so chilled and surrounded by trees.
As it's a no car site they transport your luggage on an electric cart. They were very patient as we packed and loaded the car which i massively appreciated.
We took 3 dogs and there was a simple wooded walk alongside the golf course, leading on the site as well as a few locally.
As we were in the bottom field with the composting toilets I mainly used them. No matter what time I used them they were spotless, smelled nice and had everything you would need, the best composting toilets I've used. The showers and flushing toilets were also clean and well equipped. Im very fussy about things being clean and i was really happy.
There's a bar inside the bowling club and they can cook meals if you check ahead.
Lidl is fairly close for getting pastries for breakfast. They have a fridge, freezer, prepping area and sink so easy to cook and store food.
The closest and very pretty beach at overstand was about a 30/40 minutes drive with good parking.
A big thank you to Maxine and Ethan for their friendly and welcoming arrival and departure.

Disliked
The grass cutting on the golf club was a bit noisy.
Builders are working close by and started early. Neither the fault of the campsite.
WiFi was very intermittent
showerReviews.author: Samantha Adams

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here for the 1st time last weekend as visiting the Showground and Norwich, this site is perfectly placed for that.  Showers and toilets were really good and always cleaned early morning.  Very peaceful site.  Dont rely on getting food and drinks at the bar, as not always open, which is understandable, so come prepared.  Just one suggestion, at the entrance there is no indications that there is a camp site, just a conference & bowls centre and coming along that windy road, it would make it clearer  that you are pulling into the right area.  Look forward to returning.
showerReviews.author: Jacquie Rumble

showerReviews.reviewText: The showers and toilets are lovely, new and clean. The issue we had was that that the photos of the site are somewhat misleading as they are all taken facing in one direction implying a secluded site surrounded by woodland. The campervan pitches are essentially in the car park at the back of a bowls club with views of the nearby housing estate and the air-conditioning units. If the site was fairly represented then we would have know what to expect and would have been able to make a more informed choice.
showerReviews.author: Matthew Wingrove

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped at this gorgeous campsite at beginning of September 22.
It is incredibly peaceful and the pitches are perfectly flat.
The toilets and showers are all individual units and spotless! There are currently 4 self contained units, 2 with toilets and basins and 2 with showers, toilets and basins. Please be aware that these units are raised off the floor and cannot be accessed in a wheelchair so users will have to be able to climb 2 steps to access.
There is also a great washing up area.
The staff were amazing and couldn't be more helpful!
I would definitely recommend!
showerReviews.author: Claire Deamer

locations.title: Deer's Mead Caravan & Camping Park.
locations.address: ÓÉàThe St, Norwich NR11 7QD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just spent 10 days at this wonderful adults only site.

The location is set in a lovely quiet area of Norfolk. The pitches are well spaced out and separated by well manicured hedging.

The facilities are of a high standard, but there are only 2 toilet cubicles in the male facilities and 2 showers and the ladies had 4 toilets and 2 showers and with 35 pitches I think it could do with a couple more.

The only complaint we had was the over full bins. There was only one bin for mixed rubbish and one for recycling. Both were overflowing within a day of being emptied and rubbish was overflowing into the floor with wasps everywhere.

They clearly need more bins to cope with the amount of rubbish the guests produce.

The site is perfectly located for Cromer and Sheringham as well as things further a

The information room tells you where to walk your dog on a common just out of the site, turn first left and then left again. The only common we came across was so overgrown you would struggle to spot a giraffe in amongst the grass!

Anyone looking for a peaceful retreat this is the place for you.
showerReviews.author: chris

showerReviews.reviewText: Just had a wonderful 5 night stay at Deers Mead.A nice small adults only campsite with fully serviced pitches although I did have to buy and extra length of hose from the caravan dealer just up the road to reach the water point,luckily my electric lead was long enough! The facilities were faultless,I would say better than some hotels I've stayed at and what a refreshing change it was not to have to keep pressing a button in the shower. Our pitch was one of the furthest from the facilities block so the wifi was a bit sketchy,especially when everybody was using it and it was constantly dropping out so next time I'll request a pitch closer to the block.Will definately be back next year,we've already scouted out a couple of pitches we'd like.
showerReviews.author: Rob Willmott
