showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
An Amazing Family Weekend ‚Äì Highly Recommended!

We just got back from an incredible weekend at this campsite and I can honestly say it deserves every one of these 5 stars. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by how well-kept and thoughtfully designed everything was.

The facilities were top-notch ‚Äì spotless toilets and showers, with plenty of hot water available at all times, which made the stay extra comfortable. The pitch sizes were generous, giving us plenty of space to relax and enjoy without feeling crowded.

One of the real highlights was the water equipment on site ‚Äì perfect for the kids (and adults!) to have a bit of fun and cool off. The BBQ and fire facilities were amazing too ‚Äì well set up, easy to use, and a great addition to the evenings.

A special mention has to go to Damion, the owner, who honestly couldn‚Äôt do enough for us. He was friendly, welcoming, and always around to help with anything we needed ‚Äì it‚Äôs clear he takes real pride in the place.

If you‚Äôre looking for a well-equipped, family-friendly campsite with everything you need for a comfortable and enjoyable stay, look no further. We‚Äôre already planning our next trip back!
showerReviews.author: Jack Porteous

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed overnight with family this weekend, Damien was very accommodating. He was welcoming, always up for a chat and could not fault his hospitality. Toilet and showering facilities were clean. BBQ facilities were available to use on site, and a lovely campfire for the evening. Paddleboards, canoes, kayaks and a pedalo were free to use, which meant we could all enjoy a cruise down the river to The Swan pub as a family! Would definitely recommend to anyone.
showerReviews.author: Kitty Clarke

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed overnight with family this weekend, Damien was very accommodating. He was welcoming, always up for a chat and could not fault his hospitality. showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed at this campsite for a full week around 2 weeks ago and was surprised to see a couple of negative reviews focused on the facilities. I just wanted to clear a few things up and give a fair review.

There are two toilets and a shower, all with hot water. While the sinks for washing dishes don‚Äôt have hot water, we simply filled a pan from the hot tap in the toilet sink (just a couple of metres away) and used that‚Äîhardly an inconvenience, especially when camping.

The campsite itself is in a beautiful riverside location, with canoes and paddle boards available so you can really make the most of the setting. We paddle-boarded to the pub about an hour upstream and to an old mill about an hour downstream‚Äîboth trips I‚Äôd definitely recommend.

The campsite owner is a lovely chap who really can‚Äôt do enough for you. He even set up a campfire for us and kindly let us borrow the BBQ on several occasions, which made our stay even more enjoyable.

All in all, a fantastic spot if you enjoy a relaxed camping experience in a beautiful setting with a genuinely welcoming host.
showerReviews.author: James King

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a lovely campsite! The pitches are a great size and it's in a quiet area. The facilities on site (toilets, showers and washing up area) are fantastic. There is a bath time area with buckets which you can fill with water and use at your pitch... This was a godsend considering the heatwave we were camping in! The firepit/grills provided we used non stop for cooking and keeping warm in the evenings. I love an honesty shop! It was so cute and the logs and kindling were really reasonable!
It's a big open field which is perfect for kids and out toddler had such a blast.
With only a 15min walk to 2 different pubs you can't really go wrong!
We will certainly be back again :-)
showerReviews.author: Becca Knowles

showerReviews.reviewText:
We love this campsite and have been coming here for a few years now. It's quiet and out of the way just down the road from the village of Hickling which is within walking distance.
.
But.
The facilities on the campsite have started to weather and could do with a deep clean and a refresh. It appears that since covid, a lot of the wood facilities have started to feel and become dilapidated.
I concur with another review about the lack of hot water in the showers, this has been an issue for a couple of days. Also no hot water in the toilets.
.
Usually, the shop is open but this season it's remaining closed and we didn't see any cleaners.
.
All starting to feel a bit sad, and like the owner's heart isn't in it.
We will come again, as we love the area and the quietness of the site but a little investment is needed to get it back up to standard.
showerReviews.author: William Salter

showerReviews.reviewText:
No hot water for two out of the three days of my stay was extremely frustrating. There was no communication or apology offered during the stay, and no effort made to fix it from what I saw either. Their website boasts "unlimited hot water" but that was definitely not the case.

Additionally, on the final day, the toilet facilities ran out of toilet roll. This left several of the toilets blocked and unusable after napkins were put out by the management to be used instead of loo roll. This could have been avoided with a quick trip to the shops but that didn't happen either.

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a great find this was.
We stayed here with our tentbox and I had my signwritten work van which I was aloud which I think is great as I had to go to work from the site for the two days we stayed.
The facilities are clean and always had plenty of toilet roll and hand-wash.
There are some great animals on site so great for children.
There is a honesty shop with all the essentials you would need.
Great pubs, take aways and rivers close by.
We only live 8 miles down the road but will definitely be coming back here.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Top farm.
Firstly approaching top farm i nearly missed the tiny sign with a tent and a caravan on nailed to a tree and then the driveway it was less than ideal.
It suddenly sinks down and not best for caravans, builders rubble all up the drive to the right. A field overcrowded with sheep looks like the drive could flood no stable ground. Very untidy all in all .  Just 2 toilets on our field no showers 2 showers on the entrance for the whole site not heated  it seems ¬£1 for 6 mins very dated as are all the facilities and built by amateurs Cobwebs it happens but when they're carrying dust you know the work isn't being done.  On arrival peak summer time no tents were on site if it's so good why is it so empty, the electric was to far away although we did borrow a extension. Most sites now have free WiFi not here but are proud to boast fantastic 4G , No shop for essentials. It's almost saying as a second thought we'll put a campsite here it might do ok  and knocked up ad hock .Probably the worst campsite I've experienced. I really don't know were people were looking to give such a high score for this site. I also put this review on campsites. Co.uk but they have not published it so don't believe all you see and hear
showerReviews.author: P

locations.title: utopia paradise caravan park
locations.address: ÓÉàRichmond Pl, Norwich NR9 5RF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just back from 10 glorious days. Booking was straightforward and the owner very accommodating with prompt replies to my emails.  I hoped for shade and we were guided to the perfect spot.

What I loved: having the caravan facing the lake was such a bonus. It was absolutely beautiful day and night. The owner marshalled everyone to set up for the best views.
The toilet was ideal and the shower roomy had plenty of space and lots of hot water for your token.
It was our first time paying extra for electricirt and we thought just I er ¬£1 a day very reasonable.

Not so keen: although the site itself was lovely and peaceful there was a lot of noise from the nearby water lakes activity centre. On several days there were hours of competitions and it sounded like we were at a sports or swimming gala with all the screaming and cheering.

Notes: we found the directions from the A47 took us up some lanes a bit narrow for our liking. When we left we followed the road B1535 (Roarr) to the A47 instead which was a lot easier
showerReviews.author: Heather Hannant

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just had a fabulous 4 nights ,shall definitely be back.
Pitches are huge and well figured out for families and adults alike . Pool is gorgeous and clean and plenty to do within the club house , pool table, ping pong , plenty of games books etc to keep kids entertained especially if it raining .
Food is lovely and very reasonably priced , great little shop with everything you'd need and a littlemore too, all staff are super friendly, we had a little issue with power on our second day they came straight out to help and even gave us a ehu socket hook up so we still had power, we sorted as we'd just tripped our until but so very helpful .
Shower and toilets were cleaned at least 4 times a day and kept very clean.
Very dusty as no rain so be aware if you have sensitivity due to the soil type.
Stunning woodland walks ( I saw a beautiful stag early morning ) plenty to do if you want to dive out too , from Go ape, to a Saxon village of west stow, zoos and museums too.
We live not far from Thetford can't believe we never knew about this little Gem of a place , shall definitely be back.
showerReviews.author: Vikkie Wakefield

The showers are grim, 1st day were freezing cold and no electric on site, the rest of the holiday they were hot, cold, hot, cold constantly and the smell in the bathrooms is as if they haven't been cleaned for months.
Women's toilets all overflowing with poo on the second day.
Oh and good luck finding anyone when you arrive

locations.title: St Giles House
locations.address: ÓÉà41-45 St Giles St, Norwich NR2 1JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time staying over in Norwich - we've visited before but only while staying in Norfolk. We tried this hotel based on reviews and Booking.com

It is in a nice part of town - St Giles - some distance from Cathedral (15 mins), Castle (10 mins) and Station (about 15 mins). But it is a nice neighbourhood with good restaurants. Quite a bit of Norwich is roughish, rogueish, riffish and raffish sadly, as I have found in a lot of English towns. It is a variable feast, but there's plenty to see and do especially if you are young and enjoy smoking pot.

The hotel is very grand (common parts) as it was I think an insurance company HQ back in the day. The rooms are OK - large, but bathrooms are rather dated, and towels not fluffy enough for me.

The staff are very friendly and helpful indeed. The bar is well-stocked and run. The common parts living room was nice too The breakfast was really nicely done.

Overall, it is pricier than some places, but it has charm, character, is welcoming and does much well. I would go back.

Some charming photos to help you decide whether to go to Norwich or Not(wich).
showerReviews.author: El Gold

showerReviews.reviewText: Avoid! Save your money / time and avoid this hotel. I booked for 2 nights whilst between house moves, paid extra for a suite which I was initially quite impressed by. Unfortunately it soon became clear the hotel certainly isn't up to its 4 star claim. Very old single glazed windows with no secondary glazing, meaning I could hear normal volume conversations and literally any coughs from passers by even from the 4th floor - St Giles is not a quiet street either. Wi-fi password given during check in, would be great if you could actually connect to the network from the room, which you can't so no wi-fi. Went to take a bath, body wash looked good quality even if screwed to the wall, would have been even better if it wasn't totally empty. Noise was so bad at night I had to drag the mattress through to the lounge area and sleep on the floor, during this process I discovered that under the nice clean bed sheet was a nice urine stain on the mattress / mattress cover! Extractor fan in shower room - broken! Any issues outside of normal working hours in a 4 star hotel just pop down to the front desk right? Wrong, you're given a mobile number on a piece of card in your room to call! Given the front door can be walked through by literally anyone through the night with nobody on the door and no card access required I would say that's a slight concern to have no night duty staff member about. I emailed most of the above concerns to the hotel after my first night and a few weeks later am still to receive any response, not even an apology. I checked out after 1 night and slept on the floor at someone else's house instead, to sum it up when I went to hand my key in at reception it had nobody there. Avoid avoid avoid.
showerReviews.author: Harry Kidd

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed in the Sandringham Pod with 2 kids and there was plenty of room. The pod was nice and clean, and was extremely lovely looking. Set in a park out of the way of main roads, it was a quiet area. The swimming pool is well maintained and was a welcome on the hot day we checked in. I like the idea of a security gate that requires an access code as you know your children are going to be safe. The only downside is that the mattress requires replacing as every spring was felt when sitting or laying on it, and that we had received an email to say the clubhouse and bar would not be open. We found that this was because of a license hiccup when new owners took over the park, but this was not a massive issue for us but would have been nice to have somewhere to go in the evenings. The park is a short drive from most of the coastal towns and children's attractions such as Roar and Pettetts farm. Overall a lovely place with friendly staff and holidaymakers
showerReviews.author: Tanya A

Charging ¬£40 a month for a gym that has equipment covered in rust, to the point that the weight machines do not move fluently, its filthy dirty, there was a plaster in the cup holder on one of the treadmills for 1 week before i put it in the bin myself so obviously not regularly cleaned, the water machine didn't work for nearly the 3 months I was there and still out of action the last time I went

showerReviews.reviewText: The changing room looks like they have not been cleaned in years. The smell from the urinals was overpowering. The pool side looks like it needs a deep, deep clean. Green algae and spider webs everywhere. I could go on but I'm limited by characters!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Avoid,  I joined early in the year and have since left after being fed up that  nothing had been cleaned for months. Everywhere is dirty and no one seems to care.
Showers are constantly cold, little or no water pressure and no ETA when they will have hot water    if you have more than one shower on you onky get a drip of water. Soap not often full in the loos.
Pool is gritty.  Management have to wait for China to agree for things to be done and that takes ages.  Gym machines are old and everything just seems run down , it like everyone has given up caring .
showerReviews.author: Beaty M

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have Autism Spectrum Disorder, and I usually go swimming at Fore Street almost every Saturday or Sunday. I used to enjoy this exercise and I try to do this regularly.

However, I don't know if it's just me, but I seem to notice they're recently playing a radio too loudly. One time, I couldn't even stay long, because of this. This sort of thing is unnecessary and some people need to relax while they're swimming. To be honest, I'd rather listen to nothing while doing my exercises. Unless something is done, I feel like I've been put off coming back there.
showerReviews.author: Laura Dixon

showerReviews.reviewText: The staff are amazing but sadly the facilities are rather lacking. There is always something not working, the Aircon in the gym hasn't worked for almost a year now, the girls toilet took 5 weeks before it was fixed and there's a nasty smell in the changing room every so often from the drains. For the money it costs it's not worth it as it seems the company doesn't want to fork out the money to keep it to a good standard.
showerReviews.author: Jenna Beech

showerReviews.reviewText: We arrived to friendly greetings from staff and a nice clean building. Online we had looked at mobility access and should have been able to get a wheelchair right to the pool side however this was not possible with the electric wheelchair due to the corners in the corridor. To be honest even with a Manuel chair it would have been tight. The changing room is small and cramped. The spa itself was in good working order, clean and at good temperatures. We had a lovley couple of hours there.
showerReviews.author: Emma Lifford

locations.address: ÓÉàFore St, Ipswich IP4 1JZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My daughter attends swimming lessons here and has done for some time now. She loves it and looks forward to it every week. Fran is lovely who taught my daughter in the shallow end, and now she has Ernie in the deep end. Both instructors are friendly and clearly enjoy their job. Great with the children!
So glad we chose to come here rather than crown pools.
showerReviews.author: Sarah S

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: Overall, it was a positive experience. The instructors were incredibly knowledgeable and supportive, providing excellent guidance during the swim sessions. Additionally, the customer service was exceptional, with staff always willing to assist and answer any questions.However, there were a couple of drawbacks to note. The limited space in the car parking area made finding a spot a bit challenging, especially during peak times. Additionally, while the pool itself was enjoyable, the facilities could use some improvement as they appeared to be in poor condition.Despite these minor issues, I still had a great time at Fore Street Swimming Pool and would recommend it to others, especially for the quality of instruction and customer service provided.
showerReviews.author: Evaldo Rodrigues

showerReviews.reviewText: Small swimming pool on Fore street, which makes it very accessible. Run by the Council and colleagues were very helpful. The pool itself is quite small and shallow, 1.2m deep on one side, and less on the other side. I got the impression that the water circulation and/or chlorine wasn‚Äôt enough, as the water looked dirty, and I could see small particles floating. Besides the lane dividers could be a bit more obvious, thicker maybe. Yet trade off all those for a good location, accessible and reasonably priced swimming pool.

showerReviews.reviewText: I have  recently  started swimming regularly  and have invested in an I card (season ticket).  Fore St Pool is walking distance from home and I feel so lucky to have such a beautiful little pool nearby. It is simple, straightforward  and clean   and the staff  and the other swimmers are  really friendly,  it seems like  a family!  A great enjoyable way to get fit, often there is excellent music to motivate you, ..and I love the evening sessions, it's a good night out!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our experience started off well however declined drastically mainly due to our youngest sons swimming lessons having no continuity of teachers -
With the last instructor being rude to a point where our son didn‚Äôt want to swim anymore and was visually upset .

showerReviews.reviewText: The newly revamped gym offers a good range of equipment, looks good and has more than most people would need.  The sauna and steam room are great. The pool is a good size and well maintained. What lets everything down is how dirty and wet, (a swimming costume dryer would be a great addition), the changing room floor is. It doesn‚Äôt look like it has had a proper clean for a very long time. It really does bring down the whole look and feel of the place and isn‚Äôt hygienic at all. Unfortunately half the toilets do not flush properly either. If these two things could be addressed, then the centre is definitely worth 4/5 stars for the value and facilities it provides.
showerReviews.author: Helen Ommanney-Terry

showerReviews.reviewText:
Joined a week ago. Gym is pretty tight even when it's not busy. Not the best use of space/design in my opinion.
Showers intermittent hot and cold...
Cherry on the cake was booking a virtual body combat class this morning. Really missed my combat classes. Had been looking forward to it. As soon as the class started we had problems with visuals, then sound, then totally dropped out, then visual, then sound etc etc... managed to do about 10 mins continuous exercise.  This was super-disappointing. Why? Why can't they ensure the connection is stable? Most classes are virtual,  so you'd think they would ensure it's up to scratch.
I'm still in my 14 day free cancellation period, but it's the nearest gym to me...so..
Are these issues going to be fixed?
Bad enough that the 'Fast Track' checkin is way slower than checking in at reception. I've been trying overlook this, but guys this is very poor service.
showerReviews.author: Bewgliaa Peculiaa

showerReviews.reviewText:
Atrocious place, the gym gets worse every time I visit.

Cycling machines are knackered, one feels like it rumbles when you're on it, another one screen crashed on me halfway through a workout and lost all progress (on more than one occasion). The clips that hold your feet in on the cycle machines are so worn they don't tighten, all three of them. Air con non existent near the cycle machines that have been moved infront of the biggest window in the gym, summer will be fun if I decide to continue to have my hard earned cash prised from my clutches by this place (I'm only currently staying due to close proximity for work, it's not even good value for money compared to other gyms)

The machines are way too close together; you're practically stepping around people who are working out.

Paper towel dispensers are often empty and are clearly not checked when I've had to ask to have them refilled 4 times in the last six months, even then there's a lack of urgency to do anything about the situation. The lack of care for hygiene is disturbing.

Three rowing machines directly under air con, only one or two seem to be used on any occasion, I've witnessed other complaints to staff about the new layout (which must've been designed by the producers of the crystal maze or takeshi's castle) of the gym and nothing has changed.

To top it off, half of the mens locker room keys have bands missing and more often than not the locker room smells of urine.

This is all since the "upgrade" that the gym had in december, for which it was shut for two weeks and again for additional days (for which no compensation was awarded to gym members)

I used to enjoy this place when I first came, and quite frankly I cannot recommend this place to anyone. I'm considering swapping to other gyms in the area as this simply cannot be taken as a serious facility to work out in, infact given some of the hygiene concerns, you're more likely to come away less healthy than when you entered.

Come on deben leisure centre, sort it out.

I'd like to think I'll be able to update or remove this review in the future. Time will tell.
showerReviews.author: lloyd willis

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had high hopes when I joined this gym, but unfortunately, my experience has been quite disappointing.

First off, the equipment is outdated and poorly maintained. Several of the machines are either broken or make strange noises when in use. For the amount they charge for membership, I expected far better facilities. There are barely any mirrors and no dedicated stretching space, which makes it hard to complete a full workout routine. Also no water fountain!!!

Cleanliness is another major issue. The locker rooms & the showers often have a musty smell, random pipes hanging out. The changing rooms are freezing, and a cleaner even told us that they don‚Äôt put the heating on ever. After just two sessions there, I got extremely ill, probably from how cold it was in the facility.

For the price they charge, there are far better options out there with cleaner facilities and better-maintained equipment.
showerReviews.author: Gabrielƒó ≈†iaulytƒó

showerReviews.reviewText:
It has undergone some refurbishment.
Much nicer style than advertised prior. Good layout, single floor gym with high ceilings and appropriate ventilation.

Extra layer for winter time is beneficial for low intensity sessions.

Members are mindful of each other and friendly. Plenty of hygiene stations available - clean and tidy environment.

Premium-feel gym with overall good variety of quality equipment.

2 studios available - one for spin, one open floor set-up.

Could benefit from an extra rack of fixed dumbells in 10-30kg range.

TruGym is currently offering lease for business premises just within the entrance area alongside but seperate from reception.

Value-driven, a healthy macro/micro food & catering business could potentially be a viable option as membership base appears to be busy health-focused professionals, aged 30+

locations.title: Ipswich Sports Club
locations.address: ÓÉàHenley Rd, Ipswich IP1 4NJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Compact but extensive Sports centre in a nice leafy suburb of Ipswich, offers 10 tennis courts (3 acrylic indoor, 3 hard courts in  bubble, 3 outside astroturf and 1 outdoor hard) - plus an outdoor Padel court.

7 Squash/Racquetball courts and a gym but I didn't use those.

Hockey pitches but don't know anything about that aspect.

On the whole, the place looks a wee bit desolate and dilapidated, both inside and out, and needs a thorough rebuild/refurb (hopefully forthcoming soon with proceeds from selling off adjacent land).

The Padel court is a nice new touch - I wonder if they might sacrifice another tennis court for expansion of this new (to most Brits at least) sport.

Apparently there are new lights in the indoor tennis centre (which feels like a cold warehouse in the winter) but as far as I'm concerned, they're not fit for purpose.  For a fast surface, you really need to see where the ball is to judge the bounce but it's a struggle - though I guess you'd get used to it over time.

The tennis bubble is brighter when the sun is out but that brings its own issues (with heat and glare, as it's only a single thin skin).  Once again, once the sun goes down, the place is barely lit at all.  Not great when trying to see fine line calls  üòï  The hard courts in there are slower and easier for less experienced players.

Didn't try the astroturf courts.

Food and drink isn't cheap, and costs more for non-members (tiny cup of coffee is ¬£3.50) and the social space is cramped and doesn't come across as particularly welcoming.

Staff are friendly and accommodating.

Changing rooms and toilets are very basic but clean.

Free Wi-fi.

Access from main road is a bit hairy, only one single lane entrance as far as I can tell. Didn't experience any problems personally but could see how it could cause a whole heap of traffic problems in busy periods.
showerReviews.author: Wolf 359

showerReviews.reviewText: AVOID! Dodgy owner. I filled up & paid. Later I realised I must have been overcharged (ie. the wrong pump) as the amount was SIGNIFICANTLY more than my 65ltr tank capacity and I was nowhere near empty anyway. I simply contacted the manager/owner to politely ask for the CCTV footage to be checked & establish if I'd been correctly charged for the pump I used. He immediately became aggressive & defensive - then hung up on me & blocked my calls as I couldn't get through. Highly unprofessional! I'm not going to lose sleep over ¬£30 overcharging to some dirty little rude man - but they've been reported & we will just avoid them in future. Real shame, as I've never had this in 30 years driving and this used to be a good little service station, plus the washed employee that served me was really nice. AVOID them too is my advice...
showerReviews.author: Oliver Wilkinson

showerReviews.reviewText:
We received a very competitive quote from Nathan for our house move.
From the moment we met him we felt confident he was the man for the job.
As a disabled customer he reassured me that he would sort everything including taking the beds apart and reassembly them at the new address as well as plumb the washing machine into the new bungalow.
That‚Äôs what I call service.

On move day Nathan and his assistant Kevin were prompt to arrive and after three hours solid work had our three bedroomed house in their two vans.

In just over two hours we were unpacked on our new bungalow with all furniture placed in the desired position in each room.

It‚Äôs hard these days to find trustworthy, hardworking, happy, genuine company‚Äôs but we can 100% recommend Nathan and his team at Simply Move.

The staff are the kindest we have seen in a UK hotel. All of them were chirpy, full of energy, and so polite. They served us dinner and breakfast with such joy.
The rooms are okayish- and it feels like an old property.. there are two floors- and the good part is the swimming pool and steam/sauna are free for all guests (closes at 7 pm). They were very kind and obliged all children guests with a  BIG sundae. Very thoughtful!!
The food tastes great. It is located at 7-8 mins drive to The city centre. And is right next to big Tesco, B&M, Pizza hut etc.
Good hotel, amazing staff.
showerReviews.author: Navdeep Dhillon

showerReviews.reviewText: Very basic guest house accommodation, the rooms can be on suite or shared bathrooms, pay extra for the on suite. The rooms are small, very dated, in need of modinisation, cupboard didn't have doors to save on space,  only had 1 toilet roll in the room on arrival, no shower/ shampoo given, the shower cubicle was small, the fixed shower head gave out some water, everywhere. The double bed I asked for was two singles pushed together. There is a fridge available in a communal lounge area, and a dinning area, which looked to be used as a play room, not surprisingly they do allow you to bring in your own food. Yes it has parking next to the property, yes it is 5 minutes from the train station, yes it is 20 minutes to the town center, but would I stay there again, no.
showerReviews.author: jack Lumber

showerReviews.reviewText: Due to a delay on the line I missed my connection and had a 5 hour layover in Ipswich. I rang these guys and they arranged for a member of staff to get the key to me despite it being the small hours of the morning. The room was fantastic. Beds are memory foam which was bliss after 18h on the train. Shared shower and toilet were immaculate and towels were soft. Highly recommend this to any solo traveler. Was literally 5min walk from train station too.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Friday 15th November 2024
I and my friend Alan Wood
Both stopped in room 4 of this hotel for the nights of the 15th and 16th of November.
The room had a shower and toilet on suite.
The shower heating system was not working, so we had to use the communal shower, which was not working properly also.
The room was coldish,there was tea and coffee and a kettle available.
This is a basic hotel which is ideal for football fans when ipswich town football club are at home.
This place deffinatly comes under the term cheap and cheerful üòä
This place costs for a twin room 48 pounds night

showerReviews.reviewText: Avoid weekends! Wide open, spacious, mostly peaceful  and well-kept caravan and camping site during the week, but completely packed with families and tents at the weekends, with resultant strain on shower/toilet block, which then suffer ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time here as an older couple in a caravan. On arrival we were greeted by a man and lady in a wood built check in. They were both lovely, friendly and very helpful.
We were taken to our pitch.
We had lots of space between the hedging. We did look for our electrical point and had to use our cable going across another pitch to hook up.
The grounds are lovely and well kept. Clean and tidy.
Our only issue was children, not really the children as most were really polite and no problem. The parents getting drunk and not bothering with their kids. It came to a certain time after they ate their BBQ food, they got the alcohol ready and let the children do whatever.
I'm all for adults having a good time too, but there's nothing wrong with telling their kids to not kick balls at people's caravan and tents, to not ride bikes through others pitches when they are sitting quietly with their dogs. There's so much space, gardens, grounds , Park etc.
Also, parents should be keeping an eye on very young ones going into the bathrooms by themselves. The poo on the toilet seats in the ladies, with toilet roll covered in poo, not flushed is not nice to walk in to.
The kids all about the sinks, doing makeup at 8 years old and probably not washed their hands after the toilet, put me right off going back.
This is a family place with no respect for others without children.

Location was good, but needs fencing off for a bit of peace from kids kicking balls and riding bikes right next to you. Love hearing kids play, but late at night, time to wind down and parents need to lay off the booze. Or they need to do things with their kids.
The 2 members of staff were üëç Fab.

Lovely location, lovely lake. Cafe a short walk. Great for dogs. Great for fishing. Nice scenery and walking areas.
showerReviews.author: DM Ben

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently stayed here with friends for a 50th birthday, on approach you are met with a beautiful view of Alton Water. As you enter the campsite there is a small building to the left where I believe you can book in, you follow the road and the toilet/shower block is to your right with camping pitches around it.

The pitches are not too badly sized and they do have electric hookup if needed, I believe there is bike trail you can use and I also saw someone with a fishing rod. They do allow kayaks but not inflatable.

The toilet/shower block are a bit smelly but they have showers, toilets, urinals, baby changing station, free hairdryers, shaving socket and mirrors with a lower sink for those that need it. It's worth noting they shut these toilets a 23:45, not sure why but if you need the loo during the night then the shrubbery between pitches is the only place to go. If you need to sit down you'll have to hold it till the morning.

This site does not allow campfires and this is enforced by two extremely rude wardens that ride around on an electric buggy, they are militant.

We had a group booking for a 50th birthday and unfortunately there was a family death shortly before camping at this site. Admittedly we did break the rules on the Friday and we put logs on our fire, the wardens came around and we expected to have a telling off but thought they may be firm but fair as the weather was very cold (expected this time of year I know). Not the case at all, these people are just rude and there's no other way to describe them, I tried apologising and asking them about their roles etc but they just ignored me and made us put water on the firepit. Now we're not talking about a a roaring fire on the ground, we have a firepit with Bluetooth technology to control a small fan and we were sitting under a gazebo so the fire was controlled. Nether the less we had a dispute, poured water on it and carried on with our evening. Fast forward to Saturday night and we had the coals going whilst we all sat round chatting and it was nice, the birthday boy decided to put one log on top of the coals and wouldn't you know it the buggy appeared out of nowhere and it kicked off. One of our members was a little drunk and loud and we mentioned that they'd recently lost their dad to which the female warden laughed! Now I know we shouldn't have put that log on the fire but to be honest I didn't think it would matter that much. However it did matter very much to the wardens who proceeded to ban all of us from returning to the site.

If you're on a day out and in the area then I would highly recommend visiting Alton Water, there is adequate parking and a lovely little cafe that overlooks the water. I believe you have access to a bike trail as well, parking is controlled by ANPR.

If you are looking to camp then the site is beautiful and open, all music has to be off by 22:00 so it's very peaceful to go to sleep but unfortunately due to the shrubbery being cut to knee height you have no barrier from the wind so feels a lot colder than it is and it's quite expensive for a pitch in my opinion

As long as you follow the rules to the letter you should be okay, the showers have very low water pressure and unfortunately have a very strong smell of urine (even after "cleaning"), I believe there is a fridge and a freezer in the entrance to the toilets/showers but they weren't clean when I visited, there are water spigots on the electric points but the water is highly chlorinated so will need to be boiled more than once.
showerReviews.author: Adam Bishop

It's worth noting they shut these toilets a 23:45, not sure why but if you need the loo during the night then the shrubbery between pitches is the only place to go. If you need to sit down you'll have to hold it till the morning.

This site does not allow campfires and this is enforced by two extremely rude wardens that ride around on an electric buggy, they are militant.

We had a group booking for a 50th birthday and unfortunately there was a family death shortly before camping at this site. Admittedly we did break the rules on the Friday and we put logs on our fire, the wardens came around and we expected to have a telling off but thought they may be firm but fair as the weather was very cold (expected this time of year I know). Not the case at all, these people are just rude and there's no other way to describe them, I tried apologising and asking them about their roles etc but they just ignored me and made us put water on the firepit. Now we're not talking about a a roaring fire on the ground, we have a firepit with Bluetooth technology to control a small fan and we were sitting under a gazebo so the fire was controlled. Nether the less we had a dispute, poured water on it and carried on with our evening. Fast forward to Saturday night and we had the coals going whilst we all sat round chatting and it was nice, the birthday boy decided to put one log on top of the coals and wouldn't you know it the buggy appeared out of nowhere and it kicked off. One of our members was a little drunk and loud and we mentioned that they'd recently lost their dad to which the female warden laughed! Now I know we shouldn't have put that log on the fire but to be honest I didn't think it would matter that much. However it did matter very much to the wardens who proceeded to ban all of us from returning to the site.

If you're on a day out and in the area then I would highly recommend visiting Alton Water, there is adequate parking and a lovely little cafe that overlooks the water. I believe you have access to a bike trail as well, parking is controlled by ANPR.

If you are looking to camp then the site is beautiful and open, all music has to be off by 22:00 so it's very peaceful to go to sleep but unfortunately due to the shrubbery being cut to knee height you have no barrier from the wind so feels a lot colder than it is and it's quite expensive for a pitch in my opinion

As long as you follow the rules to the letter you should be okay, the showers have very low water pressure and unfortunately have a very strong smell of urine (even after "cleaning"), I believe there is a fridge and a freezer in the entrance to the toilets/showers but they weren't clean when I visited, there are water spigots on the electric points but the water is highly chlorinated so will need to be boiled more than once.
showerReviews.author: Adam Bishop

showerReviews.reviewText: Spent a peaceful couple of nights here. The campsite is very well organised. The shower block was immaculately clean. Amanda the site manager and husband were on site for help if necessary and were friendly and accommodating. The local caf√© served tasty coffee and cakes, also did other food. Alton Water itself was beautiful in the Spring sunshine. We enjoyed walking around the site and seeing the birds and rabbits, not forgetting the lovely herd of Highland Cows! The local pub, The King's Head, served good food and drink and also very friendly, dog friendly and lovely garden at the back. A super break.

locations.title: Newbourne Woodland Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉàVirginia House, Jackson Rd, Newbourne, Woodbridge IP12 4NR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Amazing campsite. It‚Äôs the perfect mix of beautiful wilderness with the comfort of spotless facilities, fridge, charging etc. Such a calm atmosphere that filters from the owners to all the campers on site.

Pitches are very spread out and you can pick whether to be in a wooded area or open field. There are picnic benches dotted around to camp next to.

Plenty of BBQs and fire pits to borrow, and logs/charcoal available.

The toilets/showers were spotless and the fridge was huge, plus plenty of charging plugs for your phone. Not to mention a kettle!

Small shop on site had everything from fresh fruit/veg to meat and cheese, plus camping supplies. You could turn up with next to nothing and anything you need there - with very reasonable prices.

Every campsite needs to learn from this place. We will definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Jamie E

If tour looking fir a peaceful we'll run campsite you can't get any better than this the campsite consists of open area with small copies of trees and a thickly wooded area....so you can choose  where to set up.
They never take more than 18 campers so it's never overrun.
You can ha e a firepit and a BBQ
all of which are supplied on site along with charcoal and wood which is honesty bound if you use you let them know and I thi k it's about 8 pounds something of that order we brought our own but you could pitch up with nothing .... there is also a little shop up at the top

The showers and ablutions are second to none extremely modern and clean with classic fm playing

Just down the road 0.8 mile there is a lively chocolate box type pub called the Fox ..very popular

... this is a must visit
great food 18 to 25 pounds per person ....
and great fun walking back in the dark.

I think it's one of the very nicest campsites I've been to over the years.

locations.title: The Orchard Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉà28 Spring Lane, Wickham Market IP13 0SJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely location in the river Deb, just off the A12. Electric and non electric pitches. We had a nice spot right but the river, pleasant willow trees  offering shade. Fires are permitted, but only with wood purchased at the camp shop. Fires can be made anywhere pretty much, so watch out for former campfire 'holes' in the field.
Camp shop looks to have been renovated and carries all the things one might need if caught out, open most of the day, card accepted.

Dogs were permitted so that's nice. There's a nice, short, circular walk at the bottom of the site. Of course, clean up after them please...

Washroom, clean and functional with a communal covered area for washing up etc with fridges washing machine/dryer etc. I didn't really use those, but a good idea.

Location is good quite near town and Sutton hoo etc.
We went as part of a group with regular meet ups, so we will definitely be back and very happy to do so.
showerReviews.author: Tom Hardy

locations.title: Suffolk Steel House & Glamping
locations.address: ÓÉàHill House, Tattingstone, Ipswich IP9 2NT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location to go and immerse yourself in some countryside with lovely walks through Nature Reserves nearby and plenty of local places to visit. The site was fantastic. The bell tent was roomy and cosy with the fire at night that kept us toasty warm.
The kitchen facilities are great, we had everything we needed to cook at the site, and having separate bathrooms/loo for each tent is great. We enjoyed relaxing in the army tent with a book and taking in the views.
Communication with Cristabel was really good, she was very welcoming and friendly. I loved watching all the wildlife and disconnecting from the land of phone! Amazing hot shower too!!

This place is beautiful - peaceful, tranquil and with amazing views.
The tent itself was awesome. - loads of space, the bed was super comfortable and it has everything you need in there, including a log fire for chilly nights. The kitchen in the horse cart is also fully equipped with everything you could want, including a flip up table for two. The steel bathroom shack is very tastefully done and the shower was great.
Our host Cristabel clearly has an eye for detail and keeps the place immaculate. We had an amazing stay for 4 nights, enjoyed every minute and will definitely be back!
Thanks Cristabel and team - a superb place that we simply cannot recommend enough!

showerReviews.reviewText: Nick & I had a really lovely time in this glamping experience. The location is close to plenty of great walks and the site itself is spacious and secluded. However you can hear the distance noise pollution from train/cars so if you are noise sensitive in the evening, bring ear plugs! Nevertheless, the evenings were peaceful with just us (and the others occupying the 2nd tent), our pitfire and the stars. It felt very relaxing stepping away from the daily grind and tv/phones. They have really good wifi service but the aura of the place encourages you to detach. The bed was very cosy and the tent is spacious enough. The stove helps keep us warm in the evening for sure! The shared kitchen is full of amenities and they thought of everything you needed for the bbq. Also private toilet was deffo a plus and having hot water shower was handy! We also tried their pizza brick oven and the owners lent us a helping hand when they noticed us struggling a bit since it was a first time. This is also our first glamping experience and we‚Äôd love to come back here for more exploring and star gazing. The hosts are lovely, and so is the place! Keep up the good service - experience was great! I

showerReviews.reviewText:
We could not have asked for a more romantic or stylish location!
The site was very clean and quiet, with:
1. A kitchen with hot plate, 2 fridges and all cutlery & crockery you could need
2. A bathroom inside the cool steel house, private for each tent, with rainfall shower
3. Two shaded "hang-out areas" to escape the sun and enjoy the cream tea Cristabel provided
4. A bell tent with the most comfortable bed, hot water bottles and a wood stove for cold nights
Location:
The site is in a quiet village close to the Harwich Ferry and Ipswich, so it was great for us as stop before going back to Europe.
It was also beautifully located in a nature reserve - we enjoyed walking along the river (just across the meadow) and visiting the local pub (5 mins walk along the river).
Cristabel and her parents were very supportive with any issues, even our late evening check in.
showerReviews.author: Lisa

Easy to recommend, hard to leave!!

showerReviews.reviewText: My Husband and I had a brilliant time at Suffolk Steel house glamping site. Glamping  is something we do each year and we are always looking for unique sites or ones that are smaller and less contrived. Suffolk steel house is just that. There‚Äôs only two tents on the land both far apart to allow total privacy and the most wonderful view of the valley. The tents are beautiful with lovely touches inside and very posh bedding! It was unusual to have proper hot water showers and we really appreciated them as it was a very chilly weekend. It feels very family run and nothing was too much trouble for the hosts. They gave us loads of info on the local area. It‚Äôs a beautiful part of the world Suffolk and you are well positioned at this site to take full advantage of it. Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Natalie Ward

showerReviews.reviewText: This site just keeps giving and the good people running this site. Nice size pitches fully serviced. Also a nice size side with some 90 caravans and statics approximately in total. Well kept green and shrub areas with an on site cafeteria suitable for inside and outside dining. Add some good weather and some sunshine and it will be perfect. Always clean and tidy with good control of shared public areas with toilets, showers and laundry facilities including and outdoors cleaning area with sinks and hot water plus all the usual facilities. Expected on a good site. Lovely area for children to play in safety, also except dogs on leads providing you clear up after them. Have yet to try onsite cafeteria as hours of business appear to be a little speraddic current with recent weather not being so good. Looking forward to trying out the good food on offer.
showerReviews.author: John Reader

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've only spent a few months on a seasonal pitch so far. I have read previous comments and the bit that everyone goes to bed at 9 is particularly insulting. The wardens Jenny and Alan regularly throw themed nights ie quiz, Chinese etc and trust me nobody goes to bed at 9. I am a retired teacher on my own and I feel unbelievably safe there.Yrue the pitches are fairly close but they are clean dry and beautifully kept. Many of the seasonal owners have decorated their vans with ornaments, flowers and lights. I love my walks with my dog around the site .
The other great thing is the feeling of safety.Everyone seems to look out for one another without being interfering. This the first site I have left my steps and deck chairs outside the van. True there are no playing fields, but there are no football's bashing your vans or cars either.The toilets and showers are lovely and clean.The cafe is a nice little social spot and the food always smells delicious. Only thing I wish they had is a pool.An above ground one will do lol.
All in all this a nice friendly yet peaceful park and I like it
showerReviews.author: kim sharpe

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just returned from a  4 night break over Easter weekend. It's not a bad site so why only 3 stars?

The good bits.

The on site staff are very friendly and helpful.  They make you feel welcome. The single shower block is very clean and the facilities are modern. It looked like a lot of plots were fully serviced. Each has its own water, 16 amp electric and grey water drainage. They are also shingled hard standing.

The bad bits.

I know it was a bank holiday but they really pack the vans in. There is a single one way track round the whole site. The plots are all off this, centrally and along the edges. They are spaced the minimum distance apart and the service road is narrow  which makes pitching up a little difficult if you want to reverse in. There is no green space for children to play apart from what is on each individual plot. The children's "play area" is a small fenced off section with a plastic play house and a couple of swings. Worse,  it is right opposite the toilet disposal point and rubbish area and next to a storage yard. The dog walking area runs along one edge directly behind the caravans that are pitched along that section. So on a nice day, you could watch the dog walkers picking up after their dogs behind your van while you sat outside.

The site shop is very small with limited stocks. There is a tesco store about 10 minutes drive however.

Most pitches looked to be seasonal with regular visitors whose vans are permanently pitched.

I know that we stayed on a bank holiday but the cost per night was just a tad under ¬£30 per night!

Seasonal charges were around  ¬£1700 per year. It seems that whoever owns the land is very much running the site as a cash cow.

It is well placed for trips out and is near to the A14.

If you are looking for greenery and trees, look elswhere though. I would not be rushing back I'm afraid.
showerReviews.author: Dave Hillier

locations.address: ÓÉàPriory Park, Ipswich IP10 0JT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful residential location for the over 50s. Lovely houses with a nice selection of styles. The community there seems very welcoming and there are residents events held thru out the year including picnics and the like. Lovely surroundings, the Orwell Park only a short walk away and the scenic Nacton shores within a 10 min stroll. Well maintained site, set away from the A14 which dramatically reduces the noise level from the road. Swimming pool (heated) and a golf course are on site alongside a cafe/clubhouse. Worth considering if you are of 'that age' and would like to settle somewhere quiet and scenic but also away from the hustle and bustle of daily life.
showerReviews.author: Claire ‚ÄúSkidqueen‚Äù Sales

locations.title: Holiday Inn Ipswich - Orwell by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Havens 2, Ipswich IP3 9SJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location is great - was away for an anniversary weekend.  Booked via Expedia.

Everything fine on arrival, however‚Ä¶

Room advertised as a king bed.  It was not a king bed - it‚Äôs two uneven singles zipped together on castors making it an uncomfortable sleep.

Bathroom flooded with a short shower - it‚Äôs pretty gross mopping a floor with towels after a shower.

Reported to reception and was told as they are busy it would be an inconvenience for housekeeping to move us.

We were offered member points which we declined as we rarely stay in HI.  We were offered 2 free drinks again - adding insult to injury.

Hotel is noisy- you can hear other rooms, banging on floor above and the breakfast is overpriced for a cold selection of food.

Nice enough staff but seemingly apologetic but happy to allow guests to continue in rooms they are unhappy with.  No effort to even try and fix the actual issues- other guests will have the same.

Would never recommend. Disappointed with our stay.  Customer comfort is not catered for.
showerReviews.author: Gill Lockley

showerReviews.reviewText: Good value for money. Friendly staff. Liked the padlock system as you get to keep it once purchased for future visits. Flume slides well managed and fun. Clean pools. A little to busy in the tidal pool but the life guards seemed aware for safety. Only negatives were the toilet abd changing room floors. Staff were constantly cleaning the changing room floors but not inside the cubicles or toilets. People wearing shoes everywhere and ignoring the shoe covers on offer. Mud and dirt on bare feet for swimmer was vile especially in the toilets so take flip flop or crocs if you swim here otherwise you're constantly washing your feet if you're in and out if the pool area.
showerReviews.author: Lizzie B

Have not been in years, but my family and I took a trip last month and i have to say it as gone down hill.

The changing rooms are disgusting and the water is cold. The rapids are non existent and have been for years now, but they still charge full price.

No care or consideration has been taken to make amends, as the powers that be don't seem to be bothered. I will not be returning, and from the reviews you can see neither will a lot of people.

Disgraceful

showerReviews.reviewText: Just as everyone else has said! Visited today and I have never felt so dirty coming away from a swimming pool! The floors in the changing area are just vile! Used plasters (bio hazards) dirty nappies, general dirt and grime. I understand that the persons are at fault for leaving these behind initially, but nothing had been touched when we got out. Is there not a duty of care for customers? There was no evidence of regular general cleaning happening whatsoever. Expecting customers to make staff aware during a visit is an unfair response, surely cleanliness should be a priority. I would have expected there to be some kind of set standard. Such a shame to tarnish an otherwise nice afternoon out.
showerReviews.author: Shanah Callaghan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Alright gym. Friendly staff and loads of classes but a little bit pricey for what is offered.

Several bits of broken equipment that never seem to be repaired, very small free weights area and a few broken bits of tiling around the pool/shower area which isn't what you'd expect at this price range!

However free swimming with the children does go some way into making membership worth the expense over other gyms in the area.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Went for a morning last weekend whilst passing through the area.

Brilliant gym layout, the studios are all big and bright. Lots of equipment to use.

The changing rooms are big, clean, have hairdryers and have digital locks on many lockers, no need for a padlock.

Spin class with the Physical Trainer Holly was fantastic.
She really puts you through your paces and knows her stuff. Would totally recommend a session with her.

Pilates was amazing!
The instructor was really funny and encouraged the class with ease.

Spacious steam room/sauna/jacuzzi and pool!

If I was local, I'd love this as my gym.
showerReviews.author: Nick Taylor

The instructor was really funny and encouraged the class with ease.

Spacious steam room/sauna/jacuzzi and pool!

If I was local, I'd love this as my gym.

locations.title: David Lloyd Colchester
locations.address: ÓÉàUnited Way, Colchester CO4 6AT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
If I could give 0 stars, I would. While the staff and members themselves were friendly, the overall experience and management handling were extremely disappointing. From the first visit, there was strong pressure to sign a 12 month contract with no real space to think. The club was often overcrowded, the sauna was noisy and not relaxing, and the restaurant experience was particularly poor  on multiple occasions, cleaning staff started hoovering around us while we were eating, which was completely unprofessional.
Privacy was also a serious concern, with staff frequently walking through the family changing rooms as a shortcut, which made me and my wife very uncomfortable. These are management issues, not individual staff faults.
After cancelling clearly within the 14-day cooling-off period, the situation became worse. Emails were ignored, phone calls were difficult to get through, and promises of confirmation emails were not kept. There was not a single apology at any stage. Responses to feedback felt dismissive and for show only, with no real intention to resolve the problem. The handling by the Colchester sales team came across as arrogant rather than customer-focused.
Although I eventually received my refund, it only happened after a long delay, repeated chasing, and unnecessary stress. Taking money was quick; returning it was not. For a premium-priced club, this level of customer service is unacceptable, and there is clearly a lot to be learned about how to treat and communicate with customers properly.
This is not the standard I would expect from a club with this reputation, and I would not recommend it based on my experience.
showerReviews.author: Key Raz

showerReviews.reviewText:
My daughter (7 year old) was a very nervous swimmer (or not swimmer at all) until my friend recommended to try Mini Swimming lessons at Gladwins Farm. And what can I say? I am beyond impressed and happy with the progress she made so far. It wouldn't of happened, of course, without amazing swimming teachers Oliver and Gemma. They go above and beyond to make sure she feels safe and capable, and encourage her to try new techniques. She absolutely loves her teachers and I cannot be more thankful and appreciate the wonderful work that they are doing with all the children attending. I love that the classes are small, so Oliver and Gemma have enough time and attention to give to each child. Also the swimming pool is good size and not too deep, location is beautiful.
We will never be changing Isla's swimming school/teachers. If anyone in doubt regarding choosing the right teachers - run not walk, if there are any spaces left. Oliver and Gemma thank you from the bottom of my heart from me and Isla xxx.

showerReviews.reviewText:
My daughter has been attending mini swimming since she was 8 weeks old, she is now 5 and I do not have anything but praise for mini swimming. Having worked our way up through the different stages, I can see how carefully thought out the pitch and progression is at each level, from the songs and games in the baby stages to the water safety and development of strokes in the older classes. My daughters progression and confidence over the years has been a pleasure to watch, swimming independently from just 3 years old. We have been lucky enough to have kept the same teacher, Tiffany, throughout the 5 years, which has been an added bonus, she is outstanding! She builds relationships with both the children and the parents, enthuses fun and confidence into every lesson and clearly has a passion for swimming which passes through to her pupils!
The facilities are great, warm and clean with attention to detail. The office staff are equally brilliant, providing great communication about the lessons and always quick to respond to any emails.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately the gym has not met even my most basic expectations.

There is only ONE flat bench press rack. This is just unacceptable. The gym was basically empty when I attended yet I had to wait for 20 minutes to start my workout.

The gym floor, especially upstairs, was very dirty and untidy.

There was no sanitiser in sight, and I saw teenagers sneezing on machine handles, whilst complaining about how ill they were.

The bar stoppers supplied don‚Äôt grip the bar so are completely useless.

The men‚Äôs changing room absolutely stink - there‚Äôs a clear ventilation issue that needs to be addressed.

The variety and placement of equipment was just odd and nonsensical.

I wanted to leave the place the second I stepped inside. It‚Äôs literally the worst gym I have ever seen.
showerReviews.author: Joseph Campe

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been using Anytime Fitness Colchester East for over a year.  I am terrified of gyms and working out in the presence of others.  I have lost over 11 stone but still feel a little  self conscious despite the best efforts of Robin (The Manager and Personal Trainer).  This gym is perfect as it has quiet periods and. busier Ines allowing you to find your personal training zone.  I have found other members friendly and supportive without being intrusive or show offs either.  The private changing rooms set it apart from other low cost 24 hour gyms in the area.  Robin has recently taken over as Manager and he is passionate about health and fitness and has great ideas to move forward and help members achieve their goals.  It's well worth a look and visit and they have trial passes too.  Take that first step into this gym and look forward to a healthier, fitter you. I have and it works.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I started at this gym about 2 years ago and I wouldn‚Äôt change to another one if someone paid me to. They have great facilities, individual showers and toilets, a wide variety of cable machines and a good sized free weight area and a good choice of cardio machines. They also have 2 studios upstairs, one which regularly has classes running including Yoga, Pilates, Spin, Zumba, Ab Attack and Legs Bums and Tums to name a few.

Since their refurbishment in August the gym has a much more contemporary look with the addition of a sled track.
The good thing about anytime fitness east Colchester is that they are always looking at ways to improve and welcome any suggestions from members.
They have a great, friendly staff who are on hand to help with any queries you may have and will give you advice on how to get the most out of your workout.
showerReviews.author: Caroline Wishart-Young

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was a member for almost two years and I left in the summer. So I hope this review is somewhat insightful and useful for when thinking of joining a gym in the area.

There are four main areas I feel are quite important to critique on a gym. Which are: staff, facilities, cleanliness and its level of business. All of which is taking into account of its membership price ( from ¬£38 per month).

The staff are generally nice and friendly. I had no problems with them. I did find it slightly unprofessional that some of their staff are just on their phones the whole time they are on the reception desk and therefore not ready to be attentive. They do not even look up sometimes?

I felt they have a good range of equipment. Cardio to weights ratio. The gym does have a swimming pool, sauna, steam room, chaining rooms with lockers and showers. All of which are fine but for almost ¬£40 a month, I would expect more. A larger majority of the equipment and machines were fairly old. More budget friendly gyms nearby have even more modern equipment and machines.

The level of cleanliness is good in the gym floors but the showers smelt awful and the other facilities were not much better in terms of cleanliness and smell. As a result, I used the other facilities other than the gym floor a handful of times.

Now finally its level of business is pretty much its biggest pro and one of the main reasons I stayed for as long as I did. During most of the time it‚Äôs open, it is really quiet and enjoyable. There was little to no waiting time between different exercises. So it saved me a lot time, I could get a good workout at good amount of time!

Overall, Fitness4Less in Colchester does have some good things to it but I do not believe it is maximising its potential. I feel with a little bit of love (investment to refurbishment) it can be an awesome gym. If it was cheaper, I would give it higher ratings as the price should reflect exceptions. Currently, I personally do not believe it justifies ¬£40 a month.
showerReviews.author: Mateo

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a large area of open parkland combined with 3- G football facilities belonging to Colchester United, where their junior teams train and they hold tournaments and community events. The football facilities are rented out to various other clubs too.
Access to the big carpark is from Boudicca Way.
The Col Utd building adjacent to the car park has meeting rooms with changing rooms and toilets around the back.
The dropped star is due to the fact that many visiting teams are disappointed to find there are no refreshments available (and no nearby shops) plus no real shelter should it rain. Most football families are used to these sort of things though.

Two tennis courts are under a bubble; however, the lighting is truly atrocious, especially when compared to the vibrant Essex Uni ones.

The building housing it needs some TLC as it's quite old and a bit ramshackle.

Fairly pleasant location though you can always hear the traffic nearby.

A sort of down-market David Lloyd's really.
showerReviews.author: Wolf 359

showerReviews.reviewText: Brilliant squash club, great for all ages. Gym facilities are good, a bar serving coffee or beer and an outdoor space. Swimming pool, good and clean

locations.address: ÓÉàJD Gyms, 10 Purdeys Way, Rochford SS4 1NE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great equipment and space, including women‚Äôs only section. The changing rooms are also good and kept in good condition/cleanliness.
Good variety of classes at different days/times too. Gemma‚Äôs spin classes are great, so empowering and get a good sweat on!
Love that they responded to customer feedback and are now 24/7, however they removed the cleaning stations last year and I can‚Äôt understand why. People now can‚Äôt clean their own equipment down which is a bit uncomfortable sometimes.
I would say the entry QR codes are a bit annoying as they only work once a day but I sometimes go twice due to work schedules and class times - even more inconvenient now it‚Äôs 24/7 and staff aren‚Äôt always available. Also there is an ongoing issue that the front door will note open with my QR code before 6am which defeats the point of being 24/7. When I raised this with staff they simply told me it was fine and invalidates my genuine issue. Also the new wifi was good for a couple weeks but now does not work so I end up using data which doesn‚Äôt always have signal.
showerReviews.author: Ellie D

locations.title: Forest Road House Student Accomodation
locations.address: ÓÉàForest Rd, Colchester CO4 3XA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Ugly looking building, but room is large and kitchen is nice (unless you have flatmates who trash it). Very convenient location, near the uni and train station. Washing machine is confusing, gave up after first attempt. Quite a quiet building considering it's mainly for students (I suspect it also allows non-students on the down-low, as I saw a lot of older men), and the staff are very helpful (when you can find them). The main issue for me was the security, as pretty much anyone can walk into your flat without warning you first. If you're a vulnerable person or have anxiety, I would go somewhere else.
showerReviews.author: Lorna Kelly

locations.title: 27 Magdalen Street - Colchester Student Accommodation
locations.address: ÓÉà27 Magdalen St, Colchester CO1 2ZT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I began my tenancy with HOST in August 2024, starting with an en-suite for one month before moving into a studio in the same building. I want to highlight that the facilities themselves are excellent: the rooms are bright with large windows, there is plenty of storage space, and the bathroom water pressure is consistently strong and reliable. In terms of living environment and hardware, HOST does very well.

Unfortunately, my overall experience was affected by repeated negative interactions with one receptionist (a blonde lady), whose manner of communication I found highly unprofessional and at times disrespectful.

‚Ä¢	On September 14, 2024, the date of my scheduled move from the en-suite to the studio, I had just returned from a short trip (Sept 9‚Äì13). Early that morning, she knocked on my door very aggressively. When I answered, she spoke in a scolding tone, telling me something like: ‚ÄúYou must vacate this room before X o‚Äôclock!!!‚Äù (I don‚Äôt recall the exact time). While I understand she may have intended this as a reminder, the manner in which she spoke made me feel as if I had done something wrong or was being treated as a problem. I was on the phone at the time, and even the friend on the other end of the call commented, ‚ÄúWho was that? Why is she speaking to you in that way? You shouldn‚Äôt let anyone talk to you like that.‚Äù

‚Ä¢	On another occasion, when I went to collect a parcel, she happened to be outside reception smoking. After confirming I was there to pick up my package, she suddenly said in an accusatory tone: ‚ÄúI sent you an email‚Äîyou should have replied! This is about the Friday viewing for your room.‚Äù This left me feeling very uncomfortable. I am a paying resident, not an employee obligated to respond instantly to management‚Äôs convenience. While I always check my emails, I don‚Äôt believe it is fair or professional for staff to demand immediate responses or to speak to tenants as if they were subordinates.

‚Ä¢	Finally, regarding my move-out, my tenancy contract clearly stated that my final day was September 6, 2025. However, in early August, when I was simply picking up a parcel, I was once again approached and asked: ‚ÄúWhen can you return your keys earlier? We need time to clean because someone wants to move into your room sooner.‚Äù This repeated pressure to leave before the contractual end date was unreasonable‚Ä¶

However, my experience was significantly undermined by the unprofessional behavior of one receptionist‚Ä¶
showerReviews.author: C H

showerReviews.reviewText:
It is an ensuite room in student halls, not an actual hotel, but is perfect for a few nights.
Room is spacious and very clean but very basic, there was no tea or coffee but there was a box of sample cookies and gin which was nice. Staff is very friendly.
The only issues I ran into was that there was 1 full size towel when the room was booked for 2 guests.
Other than that I would recommend this place if you need a place for 1-2 people for a few nights.

locations.title: The Essex Golf and Country Club
locations.address: ÓÉàEarls Colne, Colchester CO6 2NS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here on the 22.10.2025 for one night. On first arriving in the room it appeared nice and clean.  The bathroom, however, was another matter the toilet was disgustingly dirty , the flush was poor considering the water pressure was fine. The bath plug was heavily rusted and corroding and the bath was chipped. The bathroom floor was marked badly with limescale. When laying in the bath and looking up at the ceiling there was a lot of staining, from what appeared to be water damage. On the whole there seemed to be a lack of maintenance and cleaning.
We had breakfast included and the food was dry and poorly presented.
The doors did not close quietly and so there was a lot of banging until late and early the next morning.
showerReviews.author: Chris Day

locations.title: Rushbanks Farm Caravan & Camping Site
locations.address: ÓÉàBures Rd, Wissington, Colchester CO6 4NA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time camping with our 4 year old. The team was very helpful on weather forecast and helping us on our questions. The location was easy to find and it had all as expected. Larger areas for tents, clean bathrooms, washing facilities for dishes (bring your washing liquid and sponge) and showers (although we didn't try them).
The ride to the pub is about 1.5h and requires coming out of water with the kayak so we didn't try it. But people said it's great.
The zoo was 25min drive away which is a full day activity with kids and totally worth it.
Highly recommend this camping location and it was inspired us to do more of it.
showerReviews.author: Daina Muceniece

showerReviews.reviewText:
EVERYTHING ABOUT OUR STAY WAS FANTASTIC!!! Came for a little experience in camping. Me and my pals had never camped in our lives needed to get ready and ease into it. Before we went on a trip around Europe.

AMAZING STAFF!  They were able to give us pointers on setting up camp and lots of help overall.

IDEAL LOCATION! Train station only 10 minute walk away which is only a few stops away from the beach. Furthermore very peaceful environment slept very well.

VERY CLEAN! Not only was the campsite clean and well kept the facilities (shower and toilet block) where very clean as well.

Would recommend to Everyone. Will definitely be coming back!!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a campsite (not a hotel).
The camping is split into 3 area's, one for tenters and the other two for caravans and motorhomes. Each has it's own set of toilet and shower facilities. There are plenty of fresh water points dotted around the site. Plus a chemical disposal and motorhome service point.
Pitches are very spacious and most have electricity (16a).
The whole site operates behind electric gates which allow/restrict access to 07:00-23:00
We were two sets of grandparents with our two children and grandchild, and we had a great long weekend camp, so are happy to highly recommend this siteüëç

locations.title: Mill Farm campsite
locations.address: ÓÉàMill Farm, Harwich Rd, Great Bromley, Colchester CO7 7JQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely and quiet during the evening although you hear occassional traffic during the day. It's situated right behind a lovely garden nursery so I did splash out on some good value echinaceas.  The site is split into separate areas for a) static caravans and b) tents & campervans etc.  Quite popular with Europeans as it's not far from Harwich.
Very clean, tidy, hot showers and you can park/pitch anywhere (there are no pitch markers).
Excellent wildlife - rabbits, foxes, owls and possibly the most butterflies I've ever seen in one place.  Also within walking distance of Beth Chatto gardens for those interested in gardening.
showerReviews.author: Ali slack

locations.title: Greenacres Farm - Members-Only Caravan Site
locations.address: ÓÉàChappel, Colchester CO6 2DL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A very nice, quiet, peaceful and well serviced CL site. Coin operated EHUs and shower with toilet plus another toilet. A short stroll from The Swan in Chapel (which we went to for a drink, it was very busy and the food looked nice) and also from the impressive Chapel viaduct.

We found a nice circular walk through fields, paddocks and grazing which was about 3 miles or so.

One evening we drove 15 minutes to the superb King's Head at Pebmarsh.

The CL site is a little dated in places and it worth a visit due to its facilities, location and tranquility. The is a big picnic table under a shelter for outside entertainment.
showerReviews.author: Ben Wright

locations.title: Little Ropers Woodland Camping
locations.address: ÓÉàLittle Ropers Farm, Assington Road, Bures CO8 5JX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely woodland camping spot. We were lucky enough to have the adults site all to ourselves (likely because no one else is stupid enough to brave the rain!). Stunning views over the fields. Staff were friendly and helpful. The toilet/shower block is modern and always clean.  They have cool fire pits with built in grill, and the bags of wood you buy are massive compared to some campsites. The only downside was the ground on our pitch, it had so many stones in the ground we bent a lot of pegs and had to really try to get any in, and the top soil was really loose.
Overall had a lovely time.
showerReviews.author: Ellie Mason

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
This campsite is absolutely lovely.
We stayed in a little patch of forest that had rope swings for the kids, spotless toilets and a washing up area for the 5 or so pitches.
Camp fires are allowed, there are 2 friendly llamas you can feed  and cows in surrounding fields.

Tom the owner could easily double the number of pitches to make more money instead he allowes campers to have ample personal space to enjoy.

Will definitely return again!
showerReviews.author: Joseph Kennedy

showerReviews.reviewText:
