showerReviews.reviewText: Everything about Little Ropers Campsite is perfect, we booked a woodland pitch which had tree swings for my two young daughters to play on plus plenty of woodland to explore. The amenities that are provided are spotless, clean plus pans are available for cooking food with. Everyday new hand towels are provided in toilets plus toilet roll and hand wash. The kitchen areas are spacious and well maintained. There are plenty of walks in the local area and highly recommend the Bures Dragon walk and the circular walk around the stream and fields. We will be returning for sure and what made the visit even better was how welcoming Tom & Sophie are. They even provide an A.T.V to take you and your things into camp or if your feeling strong wheel barrows are available too. Just a perfect four days for my family, thank you again Tom & So.phie
showerReviews.author: Alchemy 3

showerReviews.reviewText: Everything about Little Ropers Campsite is perfect, we booked a woodland pitch which had tree swings for my two young daughters to play on plus plenty of woodland to explore. The amenities that are provided are spotless, clean plus pans are available for cooking food with. Everyday new hand towels are provided in toilets plus toilet roll and hand wash. The kitchen areas are spacious and well maintained. There are plenty of walks in the local area and highly recommend the Bures Dragon walk and the circular walk around the stream and fields. We will be returning for sure and what made the visit even better was how welcoming Tom & Sophie are. They even provide an A.T.V to take you and your things into camp or if your feeling strong wheel barrows are available too. Just a perfect four days for my family, thank you again Tom & So.phie
showerReviews.author: Alchemy 3

locations.title: Boxted CL Caravan & Motorhome Site
locations.address: ÓÉàBoxted Rd, Boxted Cross, Colchester CO4, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely quiet CL with 2 washrooms with a toilet and shower, electric hook up, on level grass. There is information about the area in the facilities block. The owners are around if you need anything but leave you to the peace and quiet. The Alpacas in the paddock next to you are fun to watch. Lovely walks direct from the site across the field. There is a Pick Your Own farm opposite and a farm shop a few yards down the road. Very close to historical Colchester and easy accy from A12.
showerReviews.author: Sue Poley

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely quiet CL with 2 washrooms with a toilet and shower, electric hook up, on level grass. There is information about the area in the facilities block. The owners are around if you need anything but leave you to the peace and quiet. The Alpacas in the paddock next to you are fun to watch. Lovely walks direct from the site across the field. There is a Pick Your Own farm opposite and a farm shop a few yards down the road. Very close to historical Colchester and easy accy from A12.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely quiet site with countryside views.
The entrance is a bit narrow so do approach it from the south so you have room to swing and straighten the caravan before the gateway. We were ok with our 8m 7'6" caravan. Just take it slowly.
The padlocked gate is set back from the road so there's plenty of room to clear the main road before needing to stop for the gate.
The site has 5 spacious grass pitches with EHU points.
The two water taps are at either end of the fence.
There's two little wash/shower/toilet rooms, though the shower is coin operated from outside!  So we used our caravan shower instead.
The alpacers and horses were lovely to see, it added to our stay.
Didn't see the owners in the 8 days we were there, but they are very responsive to emails and were nice and helpful.
Good walks from the site and there's a cafe in the garden centre opposite.
We had a lovely stay and would return again when we are in the area. üòéüëçüëçüëçüëç
showerReviews.author: Mark Poley

I have stayed at this beautiful site on various occasions, and it does not disappoint!

This rural quiet location, clean facilities, with the added bonus of waking up to the view of beautiful animals each day.

The owners are always friendly & helpful. It is a self-service site, so once you have booked, you can just turn up without the need to check in.

See you again in June!!

Thanks Ties and Kate - we‚Äôll definitely be back.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed 6 nights, had a great time. Easy to find, entrance is narrow but we managed with no issues with big twin axle.

Site is a lovely short cut field set back from the road with trees and hedge for summer sun shelter. It was really easy to pitch as it's fairly level. Road noise was not an issue and it was really quiet at night.

EHU & recycling, chemical disposal is a manhole but fine for these small sites. What some small campervans might really like is the 2x shower/loo cubicles, very clean and nice, use of the hot shower is charged via a coin meter.

The highlight was the Alpaca's in the ajoining field so cute and peaceful to just sit and watch.

Location is great for visit to Colchester and some lovely country bike rides.
showerReviews.author: Debbie Waters

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice flat grass pitches but in 40yrs caravanning have never been on a smaller site, If there are 4 vans on site when you get there you will struggle to turn a twin axle van round, The entrance is certainly not for 8mt twin axle vans ( You wont get in ) we reversed into the PYO fruit farm on the opposite side of the road to try to get a better angle to get in, The toilets have zero hand drying facilities ( No towel, no paper towels or wall dryer ) This I  would have thought contravened Health and safety regs. The whole week we were there the chemical waste was blocked and because there is no telephone contact we had to email them to let them know, There is a tap on the side of the toilet block for swilling down after emptying the toilet water but no hose on it so unable to wash down the area after emptying chemical waste, So to reiterate this site has no real access for a standard 8mt twin axle van, Sorry but we will not be back.
showerReviews.author: Julian Perry

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a wonderful two-night stay and would absolutely recommend! The location is perfect, surrounded by beautiful walks for the dog, cosy country pubs, and completely tucked away for a relaxing escape. The pods were spotless, well-equipped, and surprisingly spacious, with a very comfortable bed. The grounds are beautifully maintained, with lots of helpful local information provided, and even a dedicated spot to wash the dogs after a muddy walk. The option to have a hot tub was a great add on especially looking out over the fields - it was incredibly relaxing. We will definitely be back - thank you for such a lovely stay!

locations.title: Waldegraves Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉàWaldegraves Ln, West Mersea, Colchester CO5 8SE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: We've just spent a week here and it was amazing. Probably the best static caravan we've ever stayed in, even had a dish washer. Facilities on site were great too. Heated out door swimming pool, driving range, mini golf, pitch and put, bike hire, the list goes on. On site fish and chips and restaurant was very good value. Evening entertainment was good and we won on the cash bingo. The only thing that I will say was that our caravan was very near the complex and could be quite loud in the evenings. Not a problem for us but anyone with young kids trying to get them to sleep might struggle with the noise a bit. But a great stay and would recommend to anyone to stay here. Oh and this place is literally on a beach, it was less than a 2 minute walk from our caravan and we were more or less the centre of the campsite
showerReviews.author: Andy_trailruns

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not worth anywhere near the ¬£50 per night plus extra for dogs

Site is like a car park but with the benefit of serviced pitches, which are very close  together and people have to walk through your pitch as no other choice. . Whilst the location is lovely, next to the creek, this by no means commands this premium price.

Toilets and showers are awful, they were clean but the water is either scorching hot or cold and it trickles out. One Washing machine broken,

Rubbish point does not have decent recycling and was over full.

No motorhome service point for draining waste. Just an elsen point.

Extra charge for dogs but nothing provided, not even a dog waste bin.

People using site that are parked up in the street outside.

Good points, pitches are clearly marked and allocated before arrival, they sited us next to our friends as requested at the time of booking.

Location is lovely with easy access to Brightlingsea beach and some good walks.

We would not come back. There are CL‚Äôs nearby for less than ¬£20 a night.
showerReviews.author: Jane Gubb-Wallace

showerReviews.reviewText: We have used this site for the last 5 yrs but sad to say I'm not willing to pay ¬£50  a night there's no warden on site very impersonal was there a week and never see no member of staff code for toilet block pitch no sent by email the toilet and shower block is VERY outdated most of the cold taps didn't work showers were either far to hot or freezing cold the so called laundry had 1 domestic washing machine and 1 domestic tumble drier such a shame as Brightlingsea is such a beautiful place

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice hotel if you travel to Colchester on a car. 15 mins drive to a Colchester city center. Paid 160 GBP for 2 rooms.  So that is a great value. There is a free parking with electric car chargers. Rooms were clean, functional, hot water, WiFi, TV. There are two floors, no lift. There is a bar and room service, but we didn't use it. Health club is a super cool feature, gym is small but has all the basics and cardio equipment, pool is ok size. Breakfast was standard British, nothing special.
showerReviews.author: Ismayil J
